author: {'steamid': '76561198036538203', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1598404031}
review:
Difficult but cute. Appeals to true wonderings I've had watching water droplets and imagining they are alive.

Gameplay is simple, but engaging. The groundwork of it is to simply roll along and jump. The way it mixes up is by the droplet walking onto particular surfaces. Some freeze her, which gives her different properties as a solid; Some boil her, turning her into a living cloud; some just undo her.

You're on limited length, inasmuch as you slowly lose mickleness as you walk, and the devs do well by having the droplet shrink as you lose water. This thearfs you to step under water leaks to gain back your mickleness.

I personally am stuck, but that's more a skill issue. As this is free, I recommend giving it a go if you like platformers and the thought of playing as a living water droplet.

review:
Eventho its a technically functioning playable game, i just cant stand it and will fail it.
I can not give it more then 2/5.
The graphics are ok and the idea is good.
But the controls, settings and "sensitivity" of the game sucks imo.
I really wanted to like this one, i took a 2 day break and then tried it again.
No. It immediately felt more annoying then anything else.
I just can not recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199018900644', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1674600930}
review:
Drop Alive is a casual platformer where an adventurous and curious water drop is trapped inside a house and needs your help to get back to the place she truly belongs to - a nearby glistening river. You need to climb a pile of jars, squeeze yourself through pipes and manage to get past a fridge full of stalactites without bursting. There are 12 levels, 3 different states, 12 unique unlockable skins and 9 achievements. It took me around 30 minutes to finish the game and, in my opinion, it has a 4.5/10 difficulty rating. It's a free game, perfect for the players that love platformers or those who are doing playthroughs/trying new games.
If you want, you can check my full game playthrough here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SB8mwItvAFk

author: {'steamid': '76561198078588463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1631408211}
review:
Este simpatico juego lo descubri cuando empece a jugar en PC y me puse a buscar opciones gratuitas en Steam, el juego para ser gratuito esta bastante bueno y el personaje al ser una gota de agua que cambia de estados es bastante simpatica. Eso si, la movilidad un poco torpe de la gota dificulta un poco las partes de plataformeo pero al tener niveles realmente cortos, no es mucho problema el iniciar una escena desde el inicio, aun que la escena del techo fue bastante complicada. Los niveles por otra parte son bastante imaginativos y le hecho de que materiales naturalmente resecos absorban el agua es un interesante detalle, un juego simple pero simpatico y gratuito.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9oZWtC4Bv2s

author: {'steamid': '76561198068174012', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1665000896}
review:
Drop Alive (2016)

You play as a little drop of water and you must clear each level. As you move and jump around your size shrinks until you evaporate out of this world like you never existed. To prevent this you  must find dripping water (or rain in later levels) to regain your size as a king among the droplets. If your frail waterdrop body touches anything pointy you explode, much like a drop of water raining down from the heavens hitting anything in its path to its inevitable doom. Should this happen you must restart the entire level, there is no checkpoints. The game looks great, I played with a controller so I can't comment on the keyboard controls, some levels are harder then others and the game is short and sweet. Give it a go, the Rain God commands you do so.

8/10

"I always like walking in the rain, so no one can see me crying."
- Charlie Chaplin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047845894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 514, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1663545766}
review:
I was ready to give this a thumbs down when I saw that I was playing as a water droplet. "Cute, but makes no sense - I would evaporate or dry up in no time."

I should've known that a game where you play as a drop of water would have taken these things into consideration, but I'd really lost faith in game developers. Drop Alive has restored a drop of my faith. Excellent innovation and creativity here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198865318009', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1659775752}
review:
Pros: Animation is cute. The sketchy art style is very appealing to the eye. Level designs are hard but not impossible, and it feels very rewarding when you finish them. It's free.

Cons: Not putting a restart level feature in a precision platforming game is just criminal. Music is very short so when you spend a lot of time on a level, it sounds super repetitive. The hitboxes of the fire in the oven level are just ridiculously too big.  it makes sense why a small portion of those who played this game have finished it (and keep in mind that it's just the third level)

author: {'steamid': '76561198062810320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1649890488}
review:
[h1]Analisi[/h1]
Sei una sola goccia rimasta in un vaso e ti stai chiedendo come ci si sente a scrollarsi di dosso questa solitudineâ€¦ CosÃ¬ ti avventuri nella realtÃ  aspra e spesso arida alla ricerca del tuo obiettivo. Per trovare la tua meta, ovvero il fiume, dovrai attraversare vari terreni e superare molti problemi. Per essere un gioco gratuito, Drop Alive non Ã¨ poi cosÃ¬ ricco di storia, ma quel poco che c'Ã¨ Ã¨ completamente arricchito con l'introduzione e l'uscita.

[h1]Grafica[/h1]
Avere una grafica adatta ai bambini non rende un gioco "infantile". L'estetica di Drop Alive sembra che tu stia giocando a un fumetto interattivo o addirittura a una graphic novel. Il suo stile abbastanza schietto Ã¨ adatto a ogni tipo di giocatore, e forse questa potrebbe essere una delle migliori caratteristiche del gioco, dato che tutto sembra uscito direttamente da una fiaba. I colori vivaci di Drop Alive e il suo aspetto disegnato a mano mostrano che gli sviluppatori hanno gestito il reparto grafico con cura.

[h1]Suono[/h1]
Non c'Ã¨ recitazione vocale.
La colonna sonora Ã¨ abbastanza carina per un gioco gratuito, non Ã¨ solo un semplice loop che viene riprodotto piÃ¹ e piÃ¹ volte fino alla nausea, ma una colonna sonora a tutti gli effetti.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Drop Alive Ã¨ un gioco platform. Il gioco non ha tutorial, ma non ne ha bisogno, poichÃ© i controlli sono semplici. L'unica cosa che controlli Ã¨ il percorso della tua gocciolina. Questo viene fatto con i tasti freccia. Il gioco ricorda Super Meat Boy in quanto un ostacolo puÃ² sembrare super facile da superare, ma quando lo raggiungi effettivamente, Ã¨ piÃ¹ una lotta di quanto inizialmente immaginato. Drop Alive non Ã¨ un gioco "a percorso unico", vale la pena esplorare i livelli. Non ci sono mappe o waypoint o persino checkpoint nei livelli, quindi dovrai esplorare per vedere cosa funziona.

L'acqua si presenta in tre stati: gas/vapore, liquido e solido. Quindi a un certo punto cadrai su una superficie calda solo per trasformarti in una piccola nuvola e dovrai cercare una soluzione piÃ¹ in alto, evitando fiamme e altre superfici calde che accorciano la durata della tua vita. Stare fermi diminuisce anche la tua taglia e quindi la tua vita, quindi non puoi semplicemente aspettare, ma devi essere sempre in movimento. Toccando una superficie piÃ¹ fresca torni in una forma liquida, rendendo possibile il salto sul muro. Quando tocchi un ostacolo congelato, ti trasformerai in un solido blocco di ghiaccio rotondo e anche se accelererai attraverso i livelli, sarai anche difficile da controllare, quindi ogni stato viene elaborato con i suoi contro e pro.

I pericoli a cui prestare attenzione in questo gioco sono per lo piÃ¹ chiari. Il fuoco fa male all'acqua e le superfici calde ti trasformano in vapore, il blu Ã¨ sicuro e le gocce ti rendono di nuovo piÃ¹ grande. I picchi, come in qualsiasi gioco platform, sono da evitare. Questi sono letali, ma a volte morirai saltando troppo vicino a loro e a volte atterrerai proprio all'angolo salvandoti, il che solleva un altro problema.
Scoprire i pericoli e cosa Ã¨ sicuro Ã¨ facile, ma quando si tratta di hitbox, il gioco Ã¨ piuttosto schizzinoso. A un certo punto potresti saltare sopra delle punte o evitare le fiamme di pochi millimetri e talvolta il gioco decide semplicemente che non ce l'hai fatta anche se eri piÃ¹ lontano dal pericolo dell'ultima volta. Non Ã¨ un grosso problema, ma dubbi del genere possono spesso portare a un gioco come se fosse ingiusto e frustrante.
Drop Alive Ã¨ anche un gioco che puoi raccogliere e rimettere giÃ¹, non devi correre attraverso di esso, il che Ã¨ una buona cosa poichÃ© alcuni livelli potrebbero irritarti con le hit box poco chiare.

[h1]PRO[/h1]
- Grafica
- ContinuitÃ  di storia tra un livello e l'altro
- Ti mette alla prova

[h1]CONTRO[/h1]
- Non sono presenti checkpoint, ciÃ² puÃ² risultare frustrante
- La trama potrebbe essere resa piÃ¹ esplicita

[h1]VOTO[/h1]
7 su 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198869251599', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1646733301}
review:
Un jeu avec du potentiel et qui peut plaire.
toutefois, les phases de plateformes (soit presque l'entiÃ¨retÃ© du jeu) sont frustrantes, tant la hitbox des obstacles et du personnage sont incertaines. Certains niveaux sont mÃªmes dÃ©testables, notamment le niveau final du jeu qui me semblait juste totalement alÃ©atoire. MalgrÃ© des imputs correctes, la goutte d'eau va dÃ©cider d'elle mÃªme de ne pas s'accrocher Ã  certains mur et donc de ne pas rebondir mais plutÃ´t de lamentablement se laisser chuter pour mourir sur le premier piÃ¨ge possible. Un enfer Ã  jouer.
La musique, visiblement pensÃ©e pour une progression non bugguÃ© est agrÃ©able sur la premiÃ¨re tentative d'un niveau, au bout de la quinziÃ¨me (il n'y a pas de checkpoint au sein d'un niveau, il faut donc reprendre au dÃ©but de chaque niveau, ce qui n'est pas dÃ©rangeant en soit mais rageant quand la survie du personnage et la rÃ©ussite du niveau ne  dÃ©pend pas du joueur), il n'y a que de la haine qui en ressort.

Enfin graphiquement, c'est une note trÃ¨s positive qui en ressort, on sent tout de mÃªme un vrai travail lÃ  dessus.
J'ai malgrÃ© tout passÃ© un excellent moment sur ce jeu, mÃªme si cela ne rachÃ¨te pas le temps perdu par les problÃ¨mes de hitbox.

review:

Drop Alive is one amazing game that in my opinion has all of the checks of what I expect from a game; the visuals are lovely, the music is on spot, the attention to detail is magnificent, the mechanics are brilliant, and even though the concept of a platform game is nothing new the game is so fun and definitely has so much to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064273177', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1636121919}
review: A really fun, short game. Also, it's free. I liked the use of elements that the Droplet can turn into, water, steam and ice. One critique would be the level selection menu. After completing the game, i wanted to get all coins in each level, but the level selection menu kept scrolling through the maps and stopping at the last map, making it a bit frustrating to select the wanted level. But it's a minor thing, really. Such a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076455611', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1629869224}
review:
This game is rough.
Nothing against the art style, but so much of this game doesn't feel well-designed. With every movement shrinking you it's completely possible to back yourself into a corner and essentially be a dead drop walking since you don't have enough water to reach the next source.
And I can't remember the last game I've found that needed checkpoints this badly. Why not have the spouts act as checkpoints, especially when the levels add instkill spikes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011736015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1605031635}
review:
*My reviews do consider the significance of gameplay, story, music, etc. before I assign a score (e.g. walking simulators don't have much emphasis on gameplay, but I wouldn't let that reflect negatively on the individual game being reviewed).

===[Audience]=== â˜Kids â˜‘Everyone â˜Casual players â˜Pro players

===[Graphics]=== â˜Bad â˜OK â˜‘Good â˜Beautiful â˜Masterpiece

===[Gameplay]=== â˜Bad â˜‘OK â˜Good â˜Beautiful â˜Masterpiece

===[Music/Sound]=== â˜Bad â˜OK â˜‘Good â˜Beautiful â˜Masterpiece

===[Requirements]=== â˜‘Minimum â˜Average â˜High end

===[Difficulty]=== â˜Very Easy â˜‘Easy â˜Medium â˜Hard â˜Very Hard

===[Game Time/Length]=== â˜‘Very Short ( 0 - 2 hours) â˜Short ( 2 - 8 hours) â˜Average ( 8 - 12 hours) â˜Long ( 12+ hours) â˜Endless

===[Bugs]=== â˜Game Breaking â˜Many Bugs â˜Few Bugs â˜‘Nothing

===[Others]=== â˜‘Single-player â˜‘Achievements â˜‘Trading Cards

===[Additional Comments]===

[h1]Summary[/h1]
Drop Alive is a cute 2D platformer developed by Invi Games. In this game, you play as a drop of water that changes between water, gas, and solid as you progress through the 12 stages and collect coins. You can use the coins to unlock a few (also cute) skins. It's totally kid friendly, but might be a little difficult for them at times (adults probably will not struggle with this at all if they're even remotely familiar with the genre). The game has leaderboard, achievement, and trading card support. 

[h1]Thoughts[/h1]
The game is decent looking. It has a cute hand animated style that I like, but the budget constraints do leave it looking very minimalist.

The gameplay is alright. It's nothing spectacular, but you can't expect much from a totally free game. The controls aren't as tight as I would prefer in a platformer (particularly the ice levels), but it feels fine. There is enough diversity in the levels to keep them interesting enough to finish the rather short game, but I could see it getting very stale if the game was much longer. Some of the collectibles can be a little bit of a challenge to find/get at first, but it was enjoyable to get them all and unlock all of the skins. I admittedly didn't know they unlocked skins until I had already collected all of them and finished the game. The music and sound is alright. Again, it's nothing spectacular, but it's way better than what I would expect from a totally free game. 

Overall, I would recommend this game to anyone that wants to play a quick platformer while they are in-between other games, or perhaps people that are looking for something to play with their kids (though, it is singleplayer).

author: {'steamid': '76561198044721583', 'num_games_owned': 4578, 'num_reviews': 676, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1599004719}
review:
A very cute and colorful bite sized platformer. I will say that, because of the slow pacing, redoing a level because of the handful of difficulty spikes can get pretty tedious, but that's for the most part only a factor if you're trying to 100% the level.

If you like sweet 2D platformers in the vain of Kirby's Adventure or Yoshi's Story, then give this one a look.

review: Reminds me of those flash games you'd find on places like Newgrounds and Y8! The graphics are all so lovely with this hand-drawn feel to them, and since it's a pretty standard platformer, it's easy to pick up the controls and blaze through the stages. It's a really good game to kill time if you've got a few hours to spare!

author: {'steamid': '76561198150772319', 'num_games_owned': 585, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1594431073}
review:
This game is nothing more than a mediocre platformer. 

While the game [i]is[/i] free, I really don't think it's worth your time. I didn't have fun at all.

The parts that make this game "unique" are the water temperatures and that you literally [i]are[/i] water. The water part is fine, albeit a little wobbly and weird, but the different temperatures are not that interesting. One makes you float up and the other makes you move much quicker. How fascinating and original... 

The movement is slow, some levels are pretty buggy, and the hitboxes are inconsistent. I'm not sure if any of this is intentional because I feel like they're the only things that make this game feel lengthy and somewhat difficult. In either case, they're implemented poorly.

I don't see why anyone would particularly like to play this game other than for its achievements or because they're just [b]that bored.[/b] Even then I'd question their decision because it took me almost two hours to 100% and playing the game normally wouldn't take more than half an hour.

In my humble opinion, this game is not worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198361973416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1596213179}
review:
If a charming & wholesome game about a literal water droplet sounds interesting to you, I'd recommend giving this a go, especially considering it's free. Despite the painfully slow movement speed and the game's short length, this shouldn't overshadow an otherwise wholesome and rewarding game. 


I should also mention the lack of checkpoints. I know many others don't like this decision but I personally don't mind it. Reflecting on my own experiences, it taught me patience and made the later levels much more satisfying to complete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198363027726', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1591529145}
review: Wow, that was .... quite frustrating but in a good way. I think it's always frustrating with this kind of game when one tiny mistake makes you start the level from the very beginning. But I really enjoyed playing it.  There was a couple of levels I thought I wouldn't finish but in the end I got to the end. In overall, I recommend the game. It's short enough not to get tiresome at some point. The mechanics and manuals aren't too hard but require you to be very precise at times, especially when you are a cloud of steam. Though I think that the achievement system is bugged. There was one or two achievements that didn't lock at first finish and I had to redo them to have them appear as finished. But apart from that I enjoyed the whole game though sometimes I was close to a breakdown when I had to redo the level for the 20th time ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198026806776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1584144319}
review:
Well.... they warned me.  [i]Drop Alive[/i] is cute.  It has pleasant, calm music. It has an appealing art style.   It looks like a casual game aimed at kids.

It really isn't.

[i]Drop Alive[/i] is a punishing platformer with no tolerance for failure.  Your drop's size/health doesn't leave you much margin for error, if any at all.  And forget wimpy handholding like checkpoints just after tricky bits. This cheerful-seeming little game stares right at your sizzling corpse with blank, lifeless eyes and says "Git gud."

If I had bought this game in the expectation of a casual stroll-in-the-park experience, I might feel rather cheated.  But at the rock-bottom price of "free," there's no grounds to complain.

review:
Hermoso apartado visual, controles buenos y jugabilidad decente, facil de entender, muy corto para mi gusto, unos 15 minutos, buena musica y sonidos.

Es gratuito y funciona en cualquier PC por tener requerimientos minimos.

Interesante para pasar el tiempo y conocer algo diferente.

review: Drop Alive is a fantastic little modern platformer. Itâ€™s been given away for free, but is well worth paying for, which you can if you like with its Deluxe Edition. It has a delightful hand-drawn art style which is works wonderfully well. If you liked Limbo and its kin then give Drop Alive a shot; itâ€™s free and well worth it. Itâ€™s frustrating at times, but rewarding, has great level design and the whole game is a fantastic little idea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050198462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1563756128}
review:
[h1] Niedliches Jump&Drop, das erstaunlich viel aus seiner grundlegenden Spielidee herausholt (Leveldesign, Spielmechaniken)! [/h1]

Besonders gut gefallen hat mir die [u] Spielmechanik [/u], dass der Tropfen mit der Zeit bzw. durch Schaden Masse verliert und wieder aufgefÃ¼llt werden muss. Dies ist nicht nur gut nachvollziehbar, weil natÃ¼rlich und nahe liegend, sondern treibt auch den Spieler voran und bringt Dynamik ins Spiel, ohne Hektik zu verbreiten (es gibt trotzdem Ruhepunkte in den Levels).

Die [u] Grafik [/u] ist hÃ¼bsch, die Spielfigur nett animiert und wÃ¤chst dem Spieler schnell ans Herz. Das erste Level beginnt sehr einfach, dann steigert sich der [u] Schwierigkeitsgrad [/u] jedoch allmÃ¤hlich (am Ende durchaus anspruchsvoll). Insgesamt hat das Spiel genau die richtige LÃ¤nge: Es endet rechtzeitig, bevor es repetitiv wird bzw. bevor der Spieler Ãœberdruss an Mechanik und Setting verspÃ¼rt.

Alles in allem [u] sehr kompetent und liebevoll [/u] gemacht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333395604', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1563064345}
review: You play as a drop of water (sometimes with cat ears) trying to navigate the terrifying and deadly obstacle course know as the modern home. Mechanically, there's clever gimmicks for each level, involving water, ice, and gas maneuvering to get to the goal. It can be particularly hard getting the tokens, and downright frustrating in later levels to complete them due to the slow physical movement, finicky jumping, and precise platforming. It's pretty rewarding, but sometimes annoying. So yeah, it's free, it's cute, and it can be pretty challenging, so go ahead and try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099949778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1561810101}
review: A free game made with a lot of love. Beautiful artwork, relaxing soundrack, cute sound effects ("Yesss!"), skins for your droplet (have you ever tried navigating a cat-faced droplet of water around mazes made of household objects?), addictive gameplay with many deaths on harder levels. Yes, it's not that easy as it seems, but as the levels are short, you don't lose too much progress if you die (although it can be quite frustrating). A few hours should be enough to finish the game with collecting all tokens and achievements. I absolutely recommend it to anyone who likes platformers and looking for a few hours of fun.

review: Short game, cute and all the better because it's free. Not sure what people are complaining about with checkpoints, the levels are brief enough that making a mistake doesn't set you back too far. Don't expect to spend days reaching the end, but do expect to enjoy the delight that is the life of a water drop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039356068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1555568628}
review:
Juego sencillo, MUY creativo y terriblemente adictivo. Totalmente recomendado para un domingo a la tarde tranquilo ;).

Jugamos con una gota de agua la cual empieza su viaje en la cocina y trata de irse, pasando por distintos lugares, adentro de un horno, una heladera, etc. 

Vamos cambiando de fases segÃºn las fases del agua (agua, vapor, hielo) segÃºn si tocamos algo que nos congele, o derrita.

En cuanto a dibujos, animaciones y mÃºsica, simplemente excelente, los dibujos muy bien logrados y la mÃºsica te sumerge en el mundo de Drop Alive segÃºn la fase que estemos.

Sin mas, 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198338532957', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1555206608}
review: Definitely more challenging than I thought it would be. The only thing I really missed in this game was the option of a checkpoint system, perhaps by allowing the player to choose between a normal and hard difficulty; that would help the game feel more fun and less punishing. Other than that, the visuals are amazing, the soundtrack is great and the gameplay doesnâ€™t get boring since each level adds some new mechanic or challenge.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198043109558', 'num_games_owned': 2065, 'num_reviews': 508, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1665779574}
review: Nice platformer with cute visuals that is much harder than it seems from the first impression. I can't say that it's a rage game, but it's often impossible to clear the level before you will know exactly where the different active zones are placed on the map. Some of them makes the water drop bigger, some of them makes a steam cloud or an icy rock out of it. On the other hand, when you will understand what the game wants you to do on the level, it becomes much more easier. Platformer fans that like the challenge will be pleased, while other types of gamers may even say that it's too hard. Anywhay, while Drop Alive is free, it absolutely deserves a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993791299', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1548111001}
review: I loved this game! The more you died the more you appreciated this cute litlte drop of water and the more you became invested in wanting it to survive. I understand why some users were frustrated by having zero check points, but that is what made the game so challenging. Trust me, I got so mad sometimes I would yell at the computer. It was frustrating, but the satisfaction of completing a level without dying was awesome! It wouldn't be as challenging if you could do a quick save. Awesome game, awesome graphics. I love this little drop of water and wish we could go on more adventures together!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986918440', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1548097425}
review:
[h1]The Good[/h1]
[list]
[*]Clean graphics
[*]Calm music
[*]Simple controls
[*]Different forms of water (drop, steam, ice)
[/list]

[h1]The Bad[/h1]
[list]
[*]No checkpoints (useful for longer levels)
[*]Looking through discussion posts, the achievement for all tokens obtained may be broken (as of Feb 2018). A user posted a fix of uninstalling the game and completing the game while obtaining all tokens along the way. *facepalm*
[/list]

[h1]The Ugly[/h1]
[list]
[*]Hitboxes: threats like spikes can kill even if lightly touched
[*]Too many threats, IMO, per level. After finishing a tricky section, you're met with more unnecessary threats.
[*]Randomness of threats: not all threats are random, but some are. When trying to determine when to move, the randomness can throw you off and kill
[*]Bugs with threats: for example, in the sewers towards the end there's a sewage drop soon after you become steam. The sewage drops onto a platform but that platform kills, despite there not being sewage and you being able to stand on a previous sewage drop without penalty.
[*]Very tight windows with threats: this is perhaps the most frustrating part of the game. Jump slightly too soon to go over spikes? Dead! Didn't time your jump with the sewage drop? Dead! RNG with certain threats killed you despite your efforts to avoid threats? Dead! Couldn't get a token in Warming Up due to extremely narrow window of opportunity? You guessed it! DEAD! Seriously, Invi Games could've made this game more forgiving, especially with wonky hitboxes and RNG.
[/list]

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
I cannot recommend the game in its current form. Invi Games could make this game fun for me by adjusting the number of threats per level, shrinking the size of threats, adding a checkpoint midway (or even make each token a checkpoint, therefore giving an additional incentive to grab them), removing unpredictability of threats, fixing RNG threats, or some combination of these.
I'm not asking for an easier game, I'm asking for more predictability and some forgiveness mechanic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327887575', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1548079632}
review:
This game has some creative mechanics and a good artstyle, but the gameplay itself is poorly executed.
I'm talking about terrible and inconsistent hitboxes, rubbish controls and no checkpoints. 
Why is having no checkpoints bad? The last levels are quite long and if you die far into the level you have to do everything again. This is also where the hitboxes come into play. When replaying a level the strategies or moves you used in your previous try may not work again because for some reason the hitboxes are not consistent.
One of the things that frustrated me the most was some of the ways levels end. An example: at the end of one level there is a hill going down and an arrow pointing towards the right of the screen. I walked down the hill that was going offscreen at the end. Apparently, walking on the part of the hill that is offscreen kills you? 
At that point I just quit the game. I had no point in continuing. 

[b] Conclusion	[/b]
Interesting mechanics and good artstyle let down by mediocre gameplay.
4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198035711234', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1545276185}
review:
A deceptively cute game about the inevitability of death. Bread kills you. Milk kills you. Flames kill you. Pipes kill you. Spikes kill you. Sparks kill you. Lightning kills you. [i]Moving[/i] kills you. Sponges kill you. Sewage kills you. I could go on... if I'd finished the game.

Your only respite from the vicious cycle is when you transform into a spike-proof ice ball and crash through walls at [i]blinding[/i] speeds. ...Only to touch a single drop of sewage that you couldn't see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198343295771', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1544774082}
review:
Warning to people planning to 100% this game. I had a hard time with "Treasure Hunter" because it appears the game does not save properly. I didn't complete all tokens in one sitting, and when I decided to continue hunting for other tokens on another play session, all the previously acquired tokens are gone. I had to start over. It sucks...

Still like the game for the challenge. But it can get frustrating at times due to games bad hit detection. *you can die even when spikes are down*

author: {'steamid': '76561198011086924', 'num_games_owned': 1083, 'num_reviews': 436, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1543028111}
review: Ok so this is a pretty little hand drawn game. I don't agree with the ending chouce but hey it's not a long game. Took me a total of 3 sessions to beat it. The last two stages are challenging but the storm stage (second before last) was difficult to a fault. That damm level sucked a big one and made playing a chore. The last level comes after and is challenging but still enjoyable and it's nice to have less difficulty after that f*cking storm level. You barely get to be ice or gas the whole game which blow because once I finally got skins that I liked the game was over :c Too short but I can't complain because at the same time, I'm gald it's over. Good game though all in all. I'd not pay more than 3 dollars if it weren't free but thankfully it is so who can complain.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984468715', 'num_games_owned': 2025, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1535608304}
review:
I weakly recommend this free game.

It has an interesting mechanic: You play as a water droplet, which can turn into steam when heated, or an ice-ball when frozen. However, there are several flaws in the execution that can make this game more frustrating than fun. Here's a quick, probably incomplete, list off the top of my head:

[list]
[*] There's a firetrap that seems to use a physics engine to determine its hitbox. This is in contrast to a platformer, like Super Mario World, there firetraps have a scripted and deterministic hitbox, so you can "learn" where it's safe to stand and where it isn't. In Drop Alive, because the fire hitbox is a physics simulation, places that were safe to stand a second ago might not be safe if the fire spreads in a different direction.[/li]
[*] There are traps that falling from the ceilings whose timing seem random. That is, rather than having a fixed timing that you can learn and try to plan to avoid, you just have to try to run/jump across and hope you get lucky.
[*] Given how easily you can die through no fault of your own, the levels are too long and have no checkpoints. It's frustrating to die to random bad luck, and have to play the whole level all over again.
[*] Each map has 3 coins to find for 100% completion, thus encouraging you to replay levels again to find all the coins you may have missed. However, the level select menu is awkward and slow to use. They should have either made it scroll much faster so you can quickly get to the level you want, or at least made it "remember" where you were, so that after you complete a level, you can just scroll to the next one on the list, instead of starting from the end of the list and having to scroll all the way to the next level you intended to play.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198287805607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1533580198}
review:
Very adorable free to play game. I've 100%'d the whole game, gaining all achievements and unlocking all the costumes. For some reason, when I went back into the game after getting the final achievement (went to unlock the costumes, you use the coins you gained to "purchase" them), the game acted as if I hadn't fully completed some levels, which as I already have the achievements and all my coins were still there so I could purchase all the unlockables, it didn't really matter. But be warned that this game does have a chance to not always save your progress. 

Also, this game has several bugs with the controls of the steam and ice form, but they weren't gamebreaking and didn't pose any threat in completing the game. The hitboxes are a bit wonky as well, and while frustrating, does end up being helpful in the last two levels so lol. 

If this game didn't have bugs, I wouldn't even be able to see why others say it's difficult. Very linear and straightforward gameplay, adorable concept and artwork, and can be 100%'d in one sitting. I had a lot of fun with the speedrunning levels (the ice form ones), and the last level is the most adorable in artwork. The game basically follows the story of a drop of water navigating through a sink in a house, going through many different backdrops and challenges along the way, to eventually esape to the outside world. The outdoors levels are the most fun and engaging, and the rooftop level implements a really cool mechanic with rain falling that I wish we had seen more of. Can recommend this to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121525707', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1532712378}
review:
Drop Alive is a pretty cute, classic, casual platformer where you play as a drop of water trying to escape from the house into the wilderness. 

Since you are a drop of water, as long as you are moving, your will eventually get smaller until you collect more leaking drops of water so you can grow back in size. There are 3 forms you can be in, as a drop of water, as evaporated steam and as a small piece of ice. Different levels will make you use different forms at certain points, but the game is pretty straightfoward without many hidden areas, so it should be easy to finish.

Game feels slow compared to regular platformers and isnt that hard, until you reach 2-3 last levels where some parts will take more effort. 12 different levels and even few skins to customize your water drop, Its not a bad way to spend some time with this one if you enjoy platformer games and if you like gathering achievements.

Pros:
- Casual
- Nice artstyle and music
- Achievements

Cons:
- Difficulty gets too high at certain parts of the map all of the sudden
- Cartoony artstyle makes some hitboxes look unprecise
- Might feel slow compared to other platformers

author: {'steamid': '76561198395857376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1532654381}
review: Great concept, cool costumes, and the music is very good for the most part.  However there are two pretty big problems with this game. The biggest one is the level select, which takes a long time to navigate and is pretty tedious when hunting for tokens. The other problem is the absence of a reset button. There are a couple gay baby jails in this game where you can get stuck but not die so you have to go through the level select again to restart the level, a process that could be made much quicker by pressing R.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999747491', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1530215968}
review:
Drop Alive ist ein kurzer, kostenloser Platformer, den man in rund 1.5 bis 2.5 Stunden durchspielen kann (je nach FÃ¤higkeiten des Spielers). Er unterscheidet sich angenehm von all dem Indie-Pixellook durch die wunderbar gezeichnete Grafik. Dieser niedliche Grafikstil und die nette "Story" Ã¼ber einen Tropfen Wasser auf dem Weg zur Freiheit machen viel vom Charme des Spiels aus. Daneben ist auch die interessante Idee mit den drei AgregatszustÃ¤nden als die man je nach Situation spielt sehr cool. Oder eben heiss, wenn mann als Dampf unterwegs ist.
Zwischendurch geht das Spiel ziemlich an die Frustgrenze, v.a. der Elektrolevel in der Mitte hat mich fast in den Wahnsinn getrieben. Umso zufriedener war ich dann aber, als ich das Spiel doch in einer annehmbaren Zeit durchgespielt hatte.

Fazit: Wer etwas Geduld und DurchhaltevermÃ¶gen mitbringt bekommt hier umsonst einen kleinen Platformer mit viel Charme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198427390684', 'num_games_owned': 901, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1552238891}
review:
A very short, but cute game with gorgeous and well-crafted design.

+: Short (as for me, it's good, or it would be really annoying otherwise).
+: Good design and heartwarming simple plot.
+: Not very challenging.
+: Simple, but unusual mechanics.

-: There are NO save points at all. Not even one. Not even when you grab a token. At the very end it might be really frustrating.
-: Controls tends to be clumsy sometimes, for example, when you try to jump off the wall - therefore, see the previous point. But it's not game-breaking at all.
-: This game is obviously controller-oriented, I tried to play with a keyboard after I finished it on controller, and it was harder to move properly.

-----

If you are interested in other games I'm playing, check my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36682541-Lonely-Dev-Reviews/]Curator page[/url]. Maybe there will be something good for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118980661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1528069792}
review:
Drop Alive is a cute little platformer with fantastic art and sound design, but with levels that can be a bit aggravating. You play as a drop of water escaping through a house towards the outside. Throughout the levels you'll transform at set points between the water drop, a small ice cube, and a cloud, each behaving a bit differently. By collecting tokens you can unlock different appearances for the character. The charming handdrawn art style alone makes the game worth playing, and the music is pretty good too. The annoying aspect of the levels is mainly that they don't have any kind of checkpoints, and you'll frequently die near the end of a level and be forced to restart from the beginning. Moving around causes the water drop to shrink, and when you don't know where the water sources are on a given level you have to be careful not to fade away, requiring a decent amount of trial and error to complete any given level. In order to place the optional collectable tokens in the levels, there are often branching paths, but in some levels this just makes it difficult to tell where you have to go. As the game is free, it is certainly worth checking out. 

[quote]For more puzzle game and platformer recommendations,  check out [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/29932239/]my Curator page[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198309061011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1523032633}
review:
3/10 Drin Score.

Recommend - Yes, it's free, the colors are lovely and vibrant, the graphics are cute, and it's not too hard.

However, take note, the controls can be tighter as it's a bit wonky. There are no checkpoints, and one hit, you die and start from the beginning of the level. There is no replayability, no story whatsoever, just pure cute platforming.

Good when you just want to start a new game and finish on one sitting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203305466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1527181124}
review:
The game is what you see as of the store page.

Why should you buy:
+ Highly saturated colours/ vibrance
+ Everything is beautiful including the colours, it's like a sketch with colours in a high graphics way
+ Minimal specs requirements and only 800mb-ish space
+ I don't know if anyone else feels the same, this game indirectly tells us not to give up despite you might not passing the mission at first try, even under different and tough situations, you need to retry and win it
+ Overall: still cute, few buttons needed only, you can play using console too, I'd say 10/10 given that it's free, until now I've passed like four or five missions, suitable for casual gamers and young kids.

Saw the reviews the story is short but I guess if it was to have a price tag, I guess under 3 bucks is considerable, note that there is a deluxe edition DLC too, do hope that more people can play this game and support the creator.

review: Ah. Cute. All cute. Cute little water drop is out there to roll. Kinda interesting premise but it's just a generic platformer. The final level with spikes sucks, in particular. But eh. I also wasn't able to go back to previous levels after beating game, strange.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085102313', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1514902001}
review:
I don't want to be too harsh with this game but this is not a good platformer. Its childish look makes you think that it is simple and easy (it is indeed simple), but it is not as easy as it seems. The game goes as follows:

The story component is barely nonexistent and that's fine for me; you are a water droplet that seeks freedom (you are inside a kitchen and want to go out to the park). Whenever you move you become smaller, you have to get to the exit of every stage without dying (you get too small = you die). There are only around 8 short stages until you finish the game, however, not many people have the "finished the game" achievement. It took me 1 hour to finish the whole game and I won't play it again because the levels were bad designed and the movement of the droplet is awful in all its forms (steamy and icy forms are awful). 

I understand that this is not a big AAA production and the game developers probably put a lot of effort into it but the game won't become any better by stating this. I didn't quite enjoy the game myself. Nevertheless, the game is free, it doesn't barely occupy any computer memory, if you want to give it a go, do it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198801656181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1531369406}
review:
First impressions, it's a decent game for the tidy sum of Free,

My only annoyance is the lack of controller support and the lack of support offered in the official DA support forums on this issue (some pending since Jan 2017).

This isn't enough to ruin the game, nor the over all game play.
Some parts are indeed challenging, requiring you to stop and think of other ways through with multiple paths available to take in the levels, and various nooks and crannies.

The graphics are simple, yet fitting for the style of game, and watching your water drop shrink away to nothing is an event you'll likely see quite often.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289195191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1566857303}
review:
Very unique game here.  My son and I dont have a lot of time into it, but so far it's pretty cool.  However, for some reason my controller will not work with this game - Xbox 360 controller I use with other games on Steam no problem.  Prompts for controller appear on screen but no response to button presses.  My son is 6 and uses controller but this is an opportunity to ease him into KB and mouse so I am not complaining about the seemingly absent 360 controller functionality.  If someone can shed some light on this issue please comment.
This is a game I would recommend for those who are into platformers or have a kid you want to introduce to gaming.  It's free right now but it would be worth it even for a price above the deluxe edition which is $2.99.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303993330', 'num_games_owned': 1425, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1517883589}
review:
I'm going to start my review by saying, this game is not as easy as it may look. I had many moments in this game, spamming the same area over and over until I finally had to take a break. If you die, you start from the beginning like many old-school platformers would make you do. It may look cute, but don't let that fool you.

That being said, this game is actually really fun once you get past the near-rage-inducing mechanics. You play as a water droplet, trying to escape the kitchen. You don't need to know much else, just take this little water drop on his adventure to escape into the world beyond the sink. Sometimes the controls are unresponsive, and I ran into my fair share of bugs while playing [spoiler](phasing through coins, coins resetting and acting like I didn't get them, landing on a safe platform and dying, glitching under the toxic sludge in the later levels, just to name a few)[/spoiler], but they are by no means game breaking. I still enjoyed this game and its charms, despite how some of the mechanics made me feel about my sanity.

If you enjoy retro platformers or platformers in general, and want to pick up a free to play game with some challenging mechanics, I'd highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162459546', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1515419582}
review:
Super cute game about being a water drop and going on an adventure around the house.

The fact that you restart the whole level when you die is rage-inducing, but it pushes you to be more careful, especially with how the controls functions as a water drop. Jumping around was harder to do compared to other platformers. Personally, I hated the stage "Too hot for my drop", but that was because getting the token above the ham was a pain in the ass to figure out, especially with how drained your drop becomes after you get out of that oven.

Other than that, I feel like the difficulty of controlling your drop's motion added to the overall feel that what you're controlling is indeed a very fragile drop of water, and is highly subject to unnecessary motion and shifting weights. The only thing in my mind while playing was how strong the drop's surface tension must be to withstand all those movements.

If you want a cute platformer that'll make you mad because of the lack of checkpoints, pick this up. I mean, the best part is that it's free!

author: {'steamid': '76561198142703486', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1514366415}
review:
I stummbled across this indie game while browsing the store and enjoyed it and wantted to write a review so here are some things i liked about the game.

-It only took me two and a half hours to 100%.
-Its free but i would of been willing to pay a around of $3.
-Its has a unique hand drawn game design for each level. (im not sure if its accualy hand drawn but it seams that way.)
-Each level has a new game mechanic for you to try and get past.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115907388', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1514112588}
review:
Pros:

+ A free platformer with truly challenging gameplay that feels fresh. 

+ Includes variety of unique levels (from everyday kitchen to dark underground sewers) that get increasingly difficult.

+ Beautiful hand-drawn animation and visuals. Each level comes with its own unique visual theme, with amazing effects like lighting and particle.

+ Simple yet adorable playable character. You play as a water drop navigating variety of obstacles to reach each level's end zone. 

+ Thanks to science, you are granted with the ability to change from one state to another (depending on your environment). For example, in order to reach high places, you can touch a steaming hot pipe to convert yourself from liquid to a puff of steam that float upwards. But your journey will end soon if you go on forever without any replenishment.

+ If the previous point is somewhat complicated, just remember you have a very cute personality.

+ Inspiring soundtrack reminded me of World of Goo.

+ It can be one of those games that feel rewarding (if you manage to overcome its difficulty and shortcomings). Or it can be a very rage-inducing experience.

Cons:

- Framerates tend to drop during certain levels. For a game like Drop Alive, this is quite odd. I suspect lack of optimization in different places.

- Some levels exhibit questionable level design. These often lead to frustrating moments that require you to try the same obstacles over and over again.

- Sluggish controls. Combined with unpredictability in framerates, some questionable level design and checkpoint system, you will be getting a game that is both challenging and ridiculous.

- Settings menu does not work. For example, I could not change the resolution. There's not a lot to customize in the settings menu either.

- Other issues like bugs. A known example that I encountered is associated to that one particular achievement which was mentioned before by other users at the Community Hub page.

Summary:

Do not underestimate the 'free-to-play' label on this game and expect to complete it easy and fast. Drop Alive is unexpectedly a hardcore platformer. Personally it's one of the most difficult games I have played. Unfortunately, I'm not really happy with some of the factors that made this game 'difficult'. But at the end it felt immensely satisfying after I managed to complete it. Drop Alive is known for its charming vibes with unique visuals, a cute little character and great soundtrack, but with some frustrating moments along the way. Give it a try !

author: {'steamid': '76561198174884434', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 668, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1558892369}
review:
Drop Alive Ã© um jogo bem simples mas bem lindo.

Pontos Negativos: 

1- O game Ã© realmente muito curto, Ã© zerado no mÃ¡ximo em 1 hora, Drop Alive pode durar mais tempo caso vocÃª queira zerar o jogo por completo assim como eu, isto Ã©, pegar todas as skins e todos os Drop (Ã© o nome do protagonista ??) de ouro.

Pontos Positivos: 

1- Eu achei sensacional a arte do jogo, nÃ£o sei se eles desenharam ou como fizeram, mas ficou divino.

2- A trilha sonora Ã© muito boa, uma das melhores coisas de Drop Alive.

3- A jogabilidade do jogo Ã© bem simples e super fÃ¡cil de compreender.

4- Pelo fato das fases serem curtas, eu atÃ© que gostei de nÃ£o ter checkpoint, para nÃ£o dizer que o jogo te dÃ¡ tudo de mÃ£o beijada.

5- Algumas pessoas podem nÃ£o ter percebido, mas as fases sÃ£o continuaÃ§Ãµes umas das coisas, eu achei isso muito bom.

Normalmente, jogos deste estilo sempre tentam passar alguma mensagem, a Ãºnica coisa que consegui extrair do game seria algo do tipo: ''VÃ¡ atrÃ¡s dos seus sonhos, persista e nunca desista'' jÃ¡ que controlamos uma gota de Ã¡gua que deseja voltar para casa, passando por muitas dificuldades atÃ© chegar ao destino.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243936698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1511639274}
review:
This was a cute one, and well done.

For me, it was hard to get used to the physics for some reason. Some jumps I would take differently every time because I couldn't figure out where I'd land. I don't think that's necessarily a fault of the game, but felt like mentioning it.

The menu was simple but a little odd. The farther you make it, the more past levels add up of course. so when selecting "start" it scrolls through all of them until reaching the one to resume from.

As for recommendations, if you have patience and like this type of game, absolutely. If it's not your type but are curious, it's a good intro to it.

Definitely should be said it's free to play, and with that, it's good at what it does and worth a play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354072245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1712324756}
review:
This game, free to play (or Â£1.99 for deluxe) is completely worth either price. Although my hours played is not the longest (thanks, offline mode) and my progress was not the quickest, I am constantly drawn back to the beautifully simple graphics and often-haunting music. I recently nominated 'Drop Alive' for a Steam Award, and the only problem was deciding which one to choose it for. In the end, "The World Is Grim Enough Let's Just All Get Along" Award was the only option, despite the many hours I have invested relaxing in this wonderful game. The levels and map design match up to the quality of the ambiance and simple controls.

Thank you and congratulations on an upcoming 1st anniversary, Invi Games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182183978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1507817910}
review:
If you have one hour of time to spare and want to play a really nice game, then please play Drop Alive. This game has everything you wish for a platformer to have. It's freaking adorable, has levels that are extremely different from each other and most of all it has a fun way it plays with difficulty.

Because of a recently hyped game I was on the look out for some free platformers that have a nice difficulty to it and found this game. The first few levels were really easy after getting the hang of the mechanics making the start really fun. After those first few easier levels things changed quite a lot. Playing through a level took several amounts of tries to finish but eventually everything worked much easier after finding the easy path. The game has in various levels different paths that lead to the goal. One of them is easier but less obvious, the other is more obvious but way harder to clear. This makes the game really fun for every sort of gamer.

On top of that what made me lose my heart to this adorable game the most was the art. The cute eyes of the droplet just make you fall in love instantly. Similar to how the really cute and fun artstyle of the background and obstacles just make you stare at everything in disbelief on how these cute looking cookies could eventually end up killing your droplet. 

It might just be my love for platformers in general but Drop Alive is one of the most adorable platformers I played and will probably have a special spot in my heart until the end of time.

review: A small lovely platform with great music and artwork. A bit easy for my taste but it definitely worth your time. I recommend it to anyone who likes platform games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970733924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1490465499}
review: 'Drop Alive' is a fun platformer game which takes place in the life of a water droplet traversing different obstacles in a regular household. The main objective is to complete each level by utilizing time management, strategy as well as skill in order to get the achievement at the end of each one. All levels in the game build off the previous one by transitioning from one area in the house to the other, which require more intuition and skill to beat. Overall, I recommend it to any platformer lover and achievement hunter, as the ones in the game are relatively easy to obtain, save the last one. In addition to that, the game is free, so that is definitely an added bonus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366333758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1507857824}
review:
Very cute game! Short, endearing, and left me with a good impression and warm memories unlike many free platformers. 

There are a few glitches here and there, most noticeably a glitch where the game doesn't properly register some of the collectable golden drops. I think two of the golden drops in the penultimate level are the culprit. Replaying that level twice to pick up the functional golden drop again (the one in the chimney, as far as I could tell) got me the Treasure Hunter achievement and the last skin! 

There is also a small glitch where, if the player moves a bit too much at the beginning of that same level when first gaining control, the water drop will get stuck under the level, forcing one to exit the level or wait for the drop to pop. Easily worked around, but I was very confused the first time it happened! 

Those few words of caution aside, this game is adorable and was definitely worth the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095413985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1504313929}
review:
just its fun for a free try but not fun to complete 

pros
>free
>drawn
>platformer

cons
<large hit box for flames
<bad overall level design 
<the gameplay gets old after a level 

After completing this game I can say that if this was bread it would be stale and expired by 2009 sure its free and I appreciate its creative design but it's just a sluggish platformer.  The overall feel is okay until you realize there isn't anything original with the game sure ohh your water but the water ball is basicly kirby and the world is copying of an odd mix of little big planet and limbo with whiffs of super meat boy. Sure the water air ice premise is nice however it does more harm than good by limiting the player's exploration and expression through the game most ofthe time you're stuck as a water droplet and the ice and gas are tossed in as gimmicks

review: Great game, but the lack of tighter controls and checkpoints really makes it infuriating sometimes especially when you're playing as a steam cloud or wall climbing as the water drop. I would've loved to see better hitboxes for the flames in the oven zone too. The concept was great which is why this gets a recommendation, but other than that don't expect the game to be easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198411743685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1505085947}
review:
Extremely cute platformer! I enjoyed the cute art and the different abilities the water droplet had when changing forms. The controller compatability was also a plus. Worth a try!

It would be nice to have some sort of in-level indication of how many coins I have collected/how many remain. However, this did not hurt my enjoyment of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205942973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1484632110}
review:
Hands down one of the best games in my Library. Easily would pay for this if had a bit more polish. That said I'm looking forward to more things from this developer. Chances are if it looks interesting to you, give it a shot you are more than likely going to enjoy it. Past that it's free so even if you don't just uninstall it and no hassle has been had.

I'd give a proper review for more than that but honestly this is a game you have to experience to really get a feel for it. It's more than what it looks like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075758240', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1501547529}
review:
[h1]Best free game i've played on Steam! 	[/h1]

In Fact, it never felt like i was playing some free cheap game.

The difficulty is fun, i died quite a few time i was expecting some casual kid game lol, the music fit well with the hand drawn art, the concept of water drop is simple but well executed, it can transform into ice or vapor. Only real problem is the gameplay in ice form is a bit stiff but you feel like you heavy so its kind of neat.

Try this if you wanna 100% a quality free game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197996681866', 'num_games_owned': 738, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1498551722}
review:
Drop Alive is OK. The concept is good but the poor mechanics were rage inducing. 

[h1]Positive:[/h1]
- Visuals and music are nice.
- I really like the concept of this game. You're a water droplet that is slowly reducing in size. Water will bring you back to normal size, and the environment can change your form (steam/ice). It's simple, but clever.

[h1]Negative:[/h1]
- My main issue with this game are the controls. It feels sluggish and sometimes unresponsive, making precision jumping more difficult than it should be. 
- Vertical movement when you are in steam form is annoying. You cannot move up faster, but you can press down (which moves you down a fixed distance). Every time you press down, you lose size, speeding up your death. If you pair this with the timing of the fire streams, it becomes a recipe for rage. 
- Death is punishing. You start at the beginning of the level and must recollect any tokens you previously found. I usually don't consider this a negative aspect (games should be challenging), but the poor controls and unclear hitbox make deaths quite frustrating. 
- The last two levels are long and frustrating to complete (especially if you want to collect all tokens). I found myself raging quite a bit in the process. 
- I encountered a glitch where some of my collected tokens randomly disappeared in the level selection screen. Although I had collected some tokens (and completed the level) it did not register. I had to replay some levels to get the achievement.

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
Drop Alive is not bad, but it's not very well polished either. I wish there was a neutral recommendation option. In its current state, I cannot recommend this game. The concept for the game is really great but the execution is somewhat disappointing. The most important aspect of any 2D platformer is the movement controls, which is sometimes lacking in this game. Thankfully it's a fairly short game and it's also free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014163253', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1499628904}
review:
[u][b]-Quick Review-[/b][/u]
Drop Alive is a short 2d indie Platformer developed by Ipsilon Developments, and released Dec 6, 2016.
Drop Alive is a simple (AND FREE) quick 2d platformer you can play through the whole game in an hour or so, the final few levels are quite difficult and probably what put off most people from their experience.

[u][b]-Detailed breakdown review-[/b][/u]
[b]Story:[/b] You play as a water droplet going on an adventure. It's a 2d platformer, what do you want? Mario is an Italian Plumber jumping on mushroom people and fighting a giant turtle, 2d platformers can be about literally anything.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=955508501

[b]Gameplay:[/b] As you progress through the game the water droplet gets turned into water vapor, and also gets frozen into an ice ball.

Keep in mind that while you move as a water droplet you slowly lose water... until you eventually disappear and then need to restart the level.

You can re-hydrate at several locations, as well as gathering extra golden tokens.
[i](for the achievers: You can get a token, and die, and finish without it, as long as you touched the token and finished the level you get credit for getting all tokens.)[/i]

[b]Conclusion:[/b] I wanted to play a short little game, and hoped to get some easy achievements... and that's pretty much what I got. Like I said, the final few levels were rough, but everything else was an enjoyable cute experience.

Once again, the game is free and only an hour long. If you want a diversion, do download and play it really quick.

[b]My Thoughts Video:[/b]
https://youtu.be/-8EYdgYZ2ss

review: Completed the whole game and, as many others wrote before me, struggled a lot with sloppy controls. Therefore, regardless of the joy this actually fun and cute game brings along, it was a pain to finish untill the end. Especially the electric level. I realised the last achievement wouldn't unlock, despite all the tokens having been collected. After I've read that the developer claimed you have to reset your stats ingame so the counter would work again, I did, and not only did the counter still not work, it also reset all achievements of this game in my steam account to zero, erasing everything I worked for. Frustrating experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101327149', 'num_games_owned': 752, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1517306623}
review:
A cute, fun and short game that can actually get pretty difficult at times.
But the music was pretty motivating and kept me going.
The setting is especially pleasant.

It's a free game, check it out.
Why not, right? 
I did, and I don't regret anything.

(Apart from killing the cute water droplet over and over again; that I do regret)

author: {'steamid': '76561198165806851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1499106394}
review: "Drop Alive" is a free, short platform game. As a player, you must control a water droplet in its way through the hostile world. The droplet can be in three different forms, depending on an environment - liquid, ice or water vapour. Each of the form have different properties eg. liquid water can stick to the walls due to adhesive forces, vapor goes constantly upwards. Game has a cartoon-like graphics. It is relatively easy, but there are places where you may be frustrated. If you want to find all tokens, not just finish the game, it can be a bit harder. There is some bug in achievement counter. Overall, the game is ok.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973041453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1500932284}
review:
A beautifully drawn free to play game. A gentle platformer, with some tricky elements to navigate. Although at times it is a little awkward to control, afterall you are a cute bouncing drop of water gradually getting smaller and smaller, it does not detract from the game play too much.

Well worth recommending for the beauty of the animation and also the gameplay which is quite easy to complete for all those who want to collect all the achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015003424', 'num_games_owned': 1489, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1499180581}
review: Drop Alive is a cute platformer with good-looking stylized graphics and pleasant music, and some nice easy levels. As well as some very frustrating levels. Especially bits where the drop turns into a nigh uncontrollable ice ball that moves too fast and requires constant anticipatory leaps of faith because the screen is way too zoomed in for the breakneck speeds and there is no way to tell what's ahead. Constantly reloading from the start of the level when the exit was already in sight, and having to collect all of the tokens every time, will make anyone's blood boil and I recommend taking frequent breaks with something less stressful to re-center your chi. Menus only add to the frustration, having to cycle through everything just to get to the right item. Especially the level selection screen that can totally give someone motion sickness looking at the flashing screens, trying to find the one level with a missing token. At the end of the day, though, the game is free, well executed for the most part, and can be beaten in a couple of hours so I see no reason not to recommend you try it for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078978294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1499047509}
review:
Of all the different genres of video games Iâ€™ve experienced, 2-D platformers have always been my favorite. There are few things I enjoy more than sitting down with a snack and a glass of water to enjoy a well-made 2-D platformer. As such, you can probably imagine my excitement upon finding a free platformer on Steam with a relatively high user score. Eager for what was likely to come, I rapidly downloaded the game and began playing, filled with hope for the upcoming adventure and joy for returning to the realm of platformers.

	By the time I finished Drop Alive just under an hour and a half later, all of that hope and happiness had degenerated into disappointment and frustration.

	To the gameâ€™s credit, its graphics and music are both top notch. In fact, it was the former aspect that initially caught my attention before I realized that the game was a 2-D platformer. It has a beautiful art style which appears to be hand-drawn and any animations seem fluid and natural. Likewise, the music perfectly complements the moods of the stages established through their graphics. In short, Drop Alive both looks and sounds (for the most part, more on this later.) amazing, an aspect which immediately hooks in prospective gamers.

	Unfortunately, these gamers will realize perhaps the most fundamental weakness of Drop Alive as soon as they pick up their controllers: the control. While the main characterâ€™s vertical motion is alright, its horizontal movement is perhaps the slowest of all characters in 2-D platformers Iâ€™ve played. This leads any kind of movement in the game to feel sluggish and, by extension, thoroughly unnatural to gamers who have developed any kind of intuition with 2-D platformers. I played Drop Alive for 80 minutes total and, by the end, I was still missing jumps and dying because I just couldnâ€™t get used to the control, despite my deep experience in the 2-D platformer genre.

	[spoiler]The poor control of the main character extends to its alternate forms as well. As the player character is a water droplet, its adventure vaporizes it into a cloud of steam at certain points and chills it down to a ball of snow/ice at others. While the first transformation controls fine, the latter literally feels like it was never play-tested whatsoever. While in snowball form, the main character moves far too quickly, which makes any kind of platforming that is even remotely precise a virtual impossibility. Unfortunately, later stages combine this alternate form with jumps over lethal fluid or other hazards, leading to many premature deaths throughout the game. This issue is exacerbated by the inability to control the snowballâ€™s aerial drift after a jump, entailing even more deaths at the hands of this gameâ€™s lackluster control.[/spoiler]

	It is upon reaching these later stages where much death occurs at the hands of this gameâ€™s control that the second major issue of Drop Alive rears its ugly head: the complete lack of a health bar or checkpoints. Yes, thatâ€™s right: whenever you make a mistake in Drop Alive, you die immediately and have to start the stage all over again. In other words, in order to complete a level in Drop Alive, you need to play the stage essentially perfectly. While this game design is archaic at best and absolutely inexcusable at worst, the gameâ€™s issues related to control make this all the worse, since the game causes you to make mistakes through its faulty control and subsequently ruthlessly punishes you for making these mistakes.

	Finally, as mentioned in the section on Drop Aliveâ€™s positive attributes, while the music of the game is certainly one of the gameâ€™s strongest elements, some of the in-game sounds definitely qualify as flaws. Most notably, upon dying, the water droplet lets out a whine, as if it is on the verge of tears. As previously stated, death in this game is far more irritating than it needed to be, but this addition just made everything slightly worse. This may seem to be a minor point on the surface level, but trust me: when youâ€™re dying repeatedly due to the aforementioned problems and being forced to start at the beginning of the stage each time, the main character sobbing and moaning gets on your nerves fairly quickly.

	I honestly wish I could recommend Drop Alive. As previously stated, this game boasts a near perfect blend of music and aesthetics, which confers it a magnetic pull for potential gamers; however, I simply cannot recommend a game with such a vile combination of awful controls and literally no leeway for error. Even with its nonexistent price tag, Drop Alive still falls short of what else can be found on Steam. If youâ€™re looking for a free 2-D platformer on Steam, Iâ€™d suggest The Expendabros over this any day: while its presentation may be strictly inferior to that of Drop Alive, it stands head and shoulders over Drop Alive in the gameplay department. Drop Alive may have not wasted any of my money, but it certainly infuriated me and wasted my time. And, to be honest, I think thatâ€™s probably worse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042701126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 952, 'last_played': 1522347043}
review:
A short but interesting puzzle game, it is a simple standard platformer, the art style and music make it feel relaxing even though some levels frustrating, especially when trying to collect tokens, which is a important task to get skins for your droplet. 

Completed the game in about 4 hours, but returned for few more bc its a good choice when you have little time to play and more elabored games are hard to keep up playing little time each day, so if you have that much time to spare, do give it a shot since its completely free.

review:
Nice! Die Idee und Umsetzung sind gut. Im Prinzip ein Jump&Run. Das Spiel mit den Elementen Wasser/GasfÃ¶rmig/Eis zu kombinieren ist gelungen. Einfach ist es auf jeden Fall nicht und wer eine niedrige Frustrationsgrenze hat sollte die Finger davon lassen.
Die Grafik im painted Desgin passt gut zum Konzept. Den Entwickler sollte man sich merken! :)
