author: {'steamid': '76561198031560426', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1498658862}
review:
[h1] Drop Alive - Der Weg eines Wassertropfens[/h1]

Ein Wassertropfen ist ganz alleine in einem fremden Krug in einem fremden Haus. Er mÃ¶chte aber lieber zu seinen Wassertropfen-Freunden im Garten. Also macht er sich auf den Weg durch die KÃ¼che um irgendwie nach drauÃŸen zu gelangen.

Als Wassertropfen kann er alle drei bekannten AggregatzustÃ¤nde annehmen. Im gasfÃ¶rmigen Zustand schwebt er durch die Welt, im flÃ¼ssigen Zustand kann er rollen und hÃ¼pfen und im festen Zustand schneller rollen und weiter hÃ¼pfen.
Diese verschieden ZustÃ¤nde sind schÃ¶n in den Platformer integriert, machen die Level aber teilweise auch sehr mÃ¼hsam. Gerade als Gaswolke verliert der Tropfen schnell seine Masse und muss sich, wie aber auch im flÃ¼ssigen Zustand, regelmÃ¤ÃŸig mit neuem Wasser beladen.

Positiv herausheben muss ich die nicht linearen Hindernisse in den spÃ¤ten Levels. Bin ich es sonst gewÃ¶hnt schnell ein Muster zu erkennen, war ich hier nicht dazu fÃ¤hig. Im Spiel selbst war das ein riesen Frustfaktor, im Nachhinein finde ich das jedoch gut. Denn nicht jedes Spiel muss einfach sein.
Aber leider wird das Spiel durch teilweise sehr merkwÃ¼rdige Hitboxen unnÃ¶tig schwer gemacht. Aber da kann ich drÃ¼ber hinweg sehen.

Das Spiel wirkt auf mich handgezeichnet, den Soundtrack finde ich OK. Gerade in lÃ¤ngeren Levels nervte er mich hin und wieder.

Drop Alive kann ich nur empfehlen. Es ist kostenlos und hat mich fÃ¼r knappe drei Stunden unterhalten. Wenn auch mit einigen Frustmomenten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372064534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1504798902}
review: Drop alive is a sweet game but also a little bit difficult. You play a drop, yes, a drop. And as a drop you have to think about which properties you have, f.e. you don't like sponges but you like other drops, which make you bigger. Thinking about this, you have to deal with different problems in levels in a jump and run style. Meanwhile you have to think fast, or you die. You may not make any mistake, or you die. This game doesn't forgive. Usually, I really hate such games. I can't tell why it isn't like this in case of drop alive but I did a level sometimes 50 times. It is great and I just couldn't stop playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067133364', 'num_games_owned': 1272, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1496500899}
review: A short but cute game. It really is your standard platformer but on the casual side. The art style and relaxing music make it feel soothing even though some levels can still be unnerving, especially when trying to collect tokens - which is of course a must to get skins for your droplet [the sunglasses droplet is awesome]. Completed game and all achievements in about two hours - so if you have that much time to spare, do give it a shot - especially for the price tag - completely free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319303341', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1590705054}
review:
Quite an interesting concept, I will say. Plays just like you would expect a classic platformer would (Controls could be a bit tighter in liquid form). While it's nothing truly groundbreaking, Drop Alive is still much better than most other indie platformers on Steam. I've cleared every level up until the level "Drop Alive" (Which I beleive is the final stage?) It's more challenging than what I expected, and might be a turnoff to more novice players, as the difficulty really begins to ramp up almost a little bit too quickly starting at the electrical-themes levels.
Music was a bit repetitive at times, but it wasn't ever a bad thing. I enjoyed the leitmotif being used in a variety of styles to accentuate the current environment, and the choice of a woodwind ensemble was very soothing. A game I'd definitely reccomend to those who just want to take an hour or so and relax.

author: {'steamid': '76561198221153404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1509485634}

It's an extremely cute game, so there's that.
But it's frustrating to have to replay entire levels becuase of no checkpoint system.
It's F2P, so I'm giving it a thumbs up, otherwise not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297041674', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1600368562}
review:
Deceptively simple, especially in the first few levels. Drop Alive is a short, sweet little game with a whimsical soundtrack and an adorable drop of water as the main and only character. Collecting all the tokens can be surprisingly frustrating and there are [i]no[/i] checkpoints in levels, so be prepared. 

Great way to pass the time. And it's free! What are you waiting for?

Mit dem Steam-Controller ist das Spiel auch gut steuerbar und mit ein wenig Aufwand ist auch das Erspielen der Achievements auch nicht wirklich aufwÃ¤ndig. author: {'steamid': '76561198025204938', 'num_games_owned': 2984, 'num_reviews': 489, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1492979036}
review:
I am not a fan of platforming games, but I'm gonna have to give this (Free!) game a huge thumbs up.  As many others have stated, the platforming feats required to make it through the levels are very fair.  You'll die a LOT, but you will always understand why you died and will probably be ready for another attempt.  The graphic style is adorable and the game runs really well.  I could really see this being turned into a series of games.  Maybe a Drop RPG, or Drop Racing.  

I would love to see an "easy" mode that features checkpoints.  Some of the levels are longer than others and restarting an entire level can be a putoff.  Also, and this may just be my imagination and saltiness, but I think the "hit" radius on spikes (noticed it on Like a Drip in a Storm) may either a bit large or a bit skewed past the top of the spikes themselves.

Anyways, I loved it and cannot wait to see more from this team!

author: {'steamid': '76561198288258686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1677272012}
review: This is one of the more interesting platformers I've played, free to play or not. It doesn't take massive amounts of time to complete from start to finish if you know all the levels and can readily beat them, which is a huge plus for me. When I start seeing games that take 100+ hours to complete I immediately start thinking of most of that "game" being a movie with very little actual gaming involved. This one is pure gameplay, and it delivers exactly what I expected from it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115071870', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1492552482}
review: This game is really nice in terms of art style. I was soo happy getting into it. I REALLY wanted to like this game. Some levels are cute and funny and have enough challenge to keep it interesting. BUT some levels you will die over and over again and you will want to tear out your hair. Without a checkpoint system one mistake and you are back at the beginning of the level. It is by far the most inferiating game i have played in a long time. I am going to uninstall this game from my computer because i don't even want to look at it on my desktop. 2/10 rating and the 2 comes from the few doable levels and cute art style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120632907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1492390434}
review:
[h1] Drop Alive	[/h1]
[b] Pros: [/b]
+ Free
+ Achievements
+ Art Style 
+ Good Layout Of Levels

[b] Cons: [/b]
- Short
- Challenging to get all achievements for some people

[b] Review [/b]
Drop Alive is a cute little game that shows you the life of a drop of water. It's free and if you are into platformer games then this should be a great game for you. If you are an Achievement Hunter this is also a good free game to play, but it will probably take a little more skill then you first thought it would be. I enjoyed the art style and it ran very smoothly. It's a little tricky to get the hang of some of the levels, but all in all it was quite enjoyable. I would recommend this game to anyone who likes platformer games and free things.

[b] This was Curated for PC Beta Gaming if you would like to follow us the link is below: [/b]
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/PC-BetaG#curation

This review is just my opinion. If you liked this review please give it a thumbs up. Thank you for reading my review. If you would like to see more of my reviews the link is below: 
http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198120632907/recommended/?p=1

author: {'steamid': '76561198091980511', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1491675323}
review:
This is a hard one to really review. While I'm marking it as I won't recommend this game, I might as well start off on the good points.

The first thing that's amazing is the art. I'm a sucker for drawn art and animations and found it stunning. Reminds me of some of the old cartoons I saw as a kid.
The story is really soothing and cute as it seems like the life of a water drop trying to get back out where it belongs.
The levels from beginning to end seems to work really well in telling the story and shows the hazards that a water drop might face.

But now for the negatives...
1) While the art is wonderful, there seems to be a center point that's off at times. It's more noticable at least in steam form as when you turn left and then right, the character jolts from one direction to the next.
This became a huge problem in some of the hotter levels as when I tried to maneuver myself out of a hole... I got hit by the flames when I didn't want to move that far to either the left or right.

1b) Not only on the water drop, but the hazards markers seem very wonky. I've had times where the fire killed me when I was no where close to the fire. I have no clue why or how it happened.
Then the spike traps where at times I can jump over them easily and other times it seems that that same jump would pop the water drop.

2) The difficulty is really unfair and seems artificial. What I mean by this can be seen in the sewer level. Sometimes the sewage drops will have a certain pattern... but if you reload that save or you died and tried it again, going back to that area where there's sewage, the dropping is completely random. I've had a time where it dropped in threes and I couldn't get past it because there was no safe spot... making me have to force a death to or quit out to try again.
I would also add as I've seen other reviewers say where the no checkpoint set up really hurts it here too. Many of the deaths felt cheap as at times you have to guess what can kill you and what can't. One minute something spikey can hurt you, but other backgrounds which looks like spikes or thorns can be walked on. There's a few leaps of faith as well where you have no clue where you're going and usually ends up in a quick death and leads to a lot of trial and error of memorizing where everything is to be able to get through the level.

3) The controls at times seems a bit wonky at certain points where the water drop seems to either want to move on it's own (and no I don't mean in slush form as it makes sense with it that it would be slippery... except for times when I'm in the air and it wants to "slide" around in the air for some reason), and had one time where the water drop fell through the floor and I had to close the game and re-opened it to try again.

4) While I say the story is wonderful... the ending wasn't. It ended way too abrupt with no real explaination or understanding of the ending. What I thought the water drop would've done, as it seems to make sense as it's water, it went the other direction and... the game just goes to black and says "Thanks for playing."

Now if this was just an animation (despite the abrupt ending), I would recommend this without question as I like things like this, but as a game, I can not with the flaws it has.
One can say though, "It's bloody free so you shouldn't complain.", in which sense... I'm really not. For a free game it's not bad, but just because it's free shouldn't excuse some of the problems there are.

I hope maybe the creator(s) can see this review and just take it as some pointers than see it as a bashing as I think this game could really turn out to be a really wonderful game if a few things were tweaked.

Maybe in future projects, these problems are squashed and they make a paid released game? I'm looking forward to it.
Good luck out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116137351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1486283646}
review:
This game is a little bit of a puzzle game mixed with the platform game it obviously is. In this game you are a water drop, that has to get forward. You get smaller all the time, so you must find a spot where you can grow again. In some levels you turn into steam so you can fly, and then back to water etc. As much as I like the idea of this game, I really just didn't enjoy playing it. The physics and overall gameplay feel way too sloppy for me. It also reminds me of a game I played online for free back in like 2009, which really doesn't exactly compliment this game as the online game from almost 10 years ago was made better.
I'm going to give it a 6/10. Would be 4 for the game but the extra 2 are for the creativity.

review:
Alla ricerca di un platform migliore.

Gameplay: Mi ha davvero deluso. Per i miei gusti l'ho trovato scomodo. In alcune ore di gioco non sono mai riuscito a farmelo piacere.

Grafica e Sonoro: Ottimi. La grafica sicuramente spicca in assoluto ma Ã¨ l'unica cosa buona.

Complessivamente: Sono stato attirato dalla grafica "cartunesca" e simpatica ma appena ho iniziato a giocare i comandi non mi hanno dato un buon feeling. Gli ho dato un paio di opportunitÃ  ma non mi ha soddisfatto. Non saprei spiegarvi ma i comandi sono davvero scomodi, poco reattivi e questo mi ha rovinato tutta l'esperienza di gioco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029972608', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 406, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1489889051}
review:
[b]PROS:[/b]
+ FREE
+ charming art style
+ nice soundtrack

[b]CONS:[/b]
- really short game time
- mouse pointer does not disappear
- a couple of bugs/glitches

[b]Comment:[/b]
This game looks cute and as a casual platformer it's fun. Both the art style and the soundtrack help you relax while playing. Level design is good although not perfect. Like collecting the tokens seems a bit counter-intuitive, some require you to kill yourself in order to get them. Luckily you only need to pick up each token once. The game might still need a bit of polish. After finishing and collecting all tokens (I got the achievement) it shows me I am missing all 3 tokens on the last level and 1 from the level before the last. Also the hitboxes are inconsistent in some parts, especially against spikes and flames. Overall a nice little indie game that, while flawed, will give you some platforming fun for a little while.
------------------------------------------------------------------
[b]If you liked this review you can find more on the [/b][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28638055-Subjective-Reviews-Corner/][u]Curator page[/u][/url][b] or in my [/b][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/srcorner][u]Review Corner[/u][/url][b].[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198066879913', 'num_games_owned': 1559, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1488662657}
review:
[h1]Wasser ist nicht nur zum Waschen da![/h1]

Genau denn man kann prima mit Wasser auch ein kleines Game auf Steam durchzocken. Gemeint ist natÃ¼rlich das liebevoll gestaltende [b]Drop Alive![/b]

Ein kleiner Wassertropfen fÃ¼hlt sich in der leeren Tasse so einsam, dass er sich prombt auf den Weg in die weite Welt macht. Dazu nutzt er die besonderen Eigenschaften des Wasserelements. Als flÃ¼ssiger Wassertropfen sind Klettereinlagen kein Problem. Als Dampfwolke schweben wir an die weitesten Orte und als Eis rammen wir uns den Weg frei. Gekonnt sind diese Elemente in Szene gesetzt.

Ziel des Spieles ist es einfach salopp gesagt das [b]Ziel[/b] zu erreichen. ZusÃ¤tzlich kann man fÃ¼r weitere Outfits pro Level 3 MÃ¼nzen sammeln die diese dann freischalten.

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist am Anfang mehr als einfach wobei dieser mit zunehmenden Level immer schwerer wird. Das liegt auch eher daran das die immer grÃ¶ÃŸer werdenden Level keine Checkpoints haben und unser "Wasser" viele Gefahren trotzen muss (Eventuell mÃ¶glicher Frustfaktor).

Achievments gibt es in der kostenlosen Version ebenfalls (Bis zu 9 StÃ¼ck die man sich dann auch redlich verdient hat).
Sammelkarten hingegen findet man nur in der kostenpflichtigen Version.

Im GroÃŸen und Ganzen ist es ein wirklich liebevolles Spiel mit durchdachten Gameplay das obwohl es recht kurz ist mit vielen Details punkten kann.

[b]Chocowertung: 8 von 10 Punkten[/b] (-2 aufgrund der fehlenden Checkpoints und der am Ende auftauchenden frustierenden Stellen)

author: {'steamid': '76561197985897676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1487263768}
review:
I usually like platformer games alot but this one not that much in the end. The character is cute and the environment is well designed. Tho some parts of the game I wasn't quite sure where my little drop was dropping. I would give some sort of level info in the beginning of each level. Also the lack of check points made the harder levels really, really frustrating. I think I spent around 25 mins on the last two levels of the total 1h playtime which was enough to end the game. The ending cut scene was also a little disappointing. 

Pros:
- Basic platformer
- Nice graphics
- Cute character

Cons:
- Lack of checkpoints

I would give this a solid 3/7

review: I wonder what the AVGN would make of this one? You start off playing this game thinking it's gonna be a piece of cake but it's deceptive. Like others have said the later stages are quite tricky and it really does remind you of old school platformers. If you screw up you do it again from the start and I think it does the game credit for that tbh. Good game especially for free

author: {'steamid': '76561198213329891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1486843192}
review:
Pros
- Cute
- Interesting concept of gameplay
- Nice graphics and design
- Realistic fire 
- Token tracker
- 12 challenging levels
- Free

Cons
- Lack of level overview
- Some levels are difficult
- Lack of checkpoints 
- Lack of tutorial

This game could be further improved by:-
1) Adding checkpoints (perhaps after reaching the recharging point, 
2) Resizing the level select (because you need to click the arrow keys multiple times in order to repeat the desired level). Certainly, the devs can fit all 12 levels in one screen,
3) Adding a short tutorial on what to get (the tokens as it is important for an achievement), how the droplet functions and what to avoid. 

Overall, this could be one of my free favourite games if its not for the difficultness for I need to repeat certain levels more than 10 times and 4 hours to complete it. Perhaps, I am not good in platformer games. 

However, you should give it a try and challenge yourself. It can be frustrating but satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999721387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1486405042}
review:
-Gameplay-

It's kind of like Super Meat Boy except shorter, easier, and without the frantic moments or the badass feel.  In other words, you'll be cursing in frustration while you struggle through a tedious section, only to sigh with relief upon clearing it instead of feeling like you did something awesome.  Difficulty goes up and down from one level to the next.

-Style-

High res graphics are nice, hand drawn art style is pleasant, music is unobtrusively generic.  The player character is cutesy, sometimes annoyingly so.  Aside from the squeaky voice work, it's aesthetically enjoyable.

-Overall-

If you're looking for a free side scroller on the PC, I'd recommend Cave Story or Khimera over this one any day.  They don't look or sound as sharp as Drop Alive, but they're much more fun, creatively nuanced, story driven, immersive, memorable, etc.  The fact that either one of them is free amazes me.  Drop, on the other hand, feels exactly like freeware/shovelware.  Not a turd, but not a gem by any means.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108265772', 'num_games_owned': 1848, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1507035383}
review:
If I had to describe Drop Alive in 3 words, I would say: short, cute, and fun. This game is an interesting puzzle platformer revolving around a small water droplet's dreams of freedom. During your quest, your drop will take advantage of the 3 states of matter (gas, solid, and liquid) to get through different areas. For example, the cloud form lets your drop fly.

I was really impressed by the quality of this title for a free game. The graphics are in a cute, hand-drawn style, almost as if they come straight from the pages of a picture book. The music is well composed, and gives off the feeling of adventure. There are even cute skins you can purchase for your drop using tokens!

Overall, I would recommend this game. It has an unmistakable charm, and if it were longer, it could easily pass as a paid title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980728277', 'num_games_owned': 1354, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1485877106}
review:
It's a fun (if not frustrating) platformer, with nice artwork and well designed levels. It only took around 90 minutes to complete so can be finished in one sitting, but it's definitely worth a try.

Although as a warning, if you are the type of person to get very angry when playing things, maybe give it a miss. One or two of the levels require a lot of restarts, and it tends to happen towards the end of the level too.

review: Although the art style is nice, got extremely boring after 5 mins of play, with annoying, loud, repetitive death sounds and (as far as I could tell) no instructions anywhere on what you are supposed to be doing! Music was great but sounded quite similar to Borderlands:Pre Sequel at times... probably just me being an idiot but I didn't really get the point in this game! A lot more fun, challenging and nice looking 2D games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197784155', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1486580095}
review:
GIOCO DAVVERO ESORBITANTE! A DIR POCO MOZZAFIATO!! Nonostante a primo impatto la visione della goccia mi sia sembrata completamente insensata, pochi istanti dopo ho raggiunto la perfezione e la pace dei sensi interpretando a pieno il significato di quella banale gocciolina. :: La goccia, piccola e solitaria, rappresenta me stesso e ogni singolo individuo che rincorre, facendo riferimento all'aspetto prettamente biblico nonchÃ¨ cattolico (protestante), un obiettivo prefissatosi distante numerosi ostacoli da essa (le mensole della vita). Il raggiungimento della BROCCA rappresenta invece l'unione agli altri singoli che in modo unanime rincorrono inconsapevolmente lo stesso obiettivo e fine. N.B.: trovo a dir poco eccezionale la scelta fatta dal team di sviluppo(INVI GAMES) nell'ultimo livello della saga: LA CADUTA DELLA GOCCIA CONTINUA SUL FORNELLO DELLA CUCINA CHE NON LASCIA ALCUNO SCAMPO E RENDE VANI TUTTI GLI SFORZI FATTI DALLA GOCCIA(nonchÃ¨ individuo e comunitÃ  errante). Davvero un grande gegewupe al team di svil-uppo.














Il Vostro Amato Frank the Big[unk]
Baci.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083865809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1671425213}
review:
Drop alive es un juego plataformero en el que llevas puestas las botas en una especie de gota, la cual trata de llegar viva a fuera de la casa, lo cual es es una odisea muy poco creativa pero a la vez llamativa.

El juego se caracteriza por su simpleza y su increÃ­ble ambientaciÃ³n al estilo anime clÃ¡sico.

La Jugabilidad en ciertos puntos llega a ser molesta, pero en sÃ­ estÃ¡ bien para este juego.

La mÃºsica es bastante repetitiva y deja mucho que desear.

El Gameplay se torna increÃ­blemente difÃ­cil en algunas etapas, siendo que las otras se pueden completar en cuestiÃ³n de segundos.

A mi parecer es un juego con mucho potencial, es gratuÃ­to, no pierdes nada por probarlo, se me hizo bastante corto ya que solo tiene 8 niveles, pero en sÃ­, es un juego que debes probar si te gusta la dificultad, la simpleza Y LOS DANGOS.

PD: Cabe mencionar que los desarrolladores de este juego son latinos! Un aplauso para ellos, creo que este es su primer entrega :)

8/10 Lo recomiendo :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198127816185', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1485623680}
review:
Drop Alive is a plarformer game in which you control a water drop and clear levels in order to get from a house to a pond. The idea is quite simple. Actually, everything about this game is simple, beginning from the visuals, though the music, sound, and controls. The graphics look done by hand, which is quite unique in video games. Only one button for jumping is used alongside the analog/d-pad movement. The game is also not too long, but not too short either. It is simple, but it is this simpliness that is its biggest charm and selling point.

Each level is different, which is nice. New elements show up. The game do not bore the player. There are three types of the drop: normal water, steam when heated and ice when frozen. It surprised me at first when the drop turned into steam when it touched a heated metal pipe. I was expecting a far more simple game. It turned out to be better than I expected. There are even small touches like that a sponge sink in the water from the drop!

I really liked playing it. It felt like good old times came back, when people made games more for sharing the fun than for the money. It has â€˜this thingâ€™ in it than a lot of games today do not have.

The biggest problem with Drop Alive are bugs. They destroy the good and fun atmosphere the game brings.

review:
A real joy to play!
Not long -or difficult- enough to get bored, beautiful music and eye for detail.
The drawings, funny sounds, story and the fact this game is for free show the love put into this project.
Perfect for a rainy afternoon!

review:
Drop Alive is a pretty good 2D platformer. I enjoyed it quite a lot. You play as a cute droplet of water, jumping from platform to platform. You attempt to avoid all spikes and lava pits:

PROS -

Free to Play
Good graphics and sound
Lag free
Easy controls

CONS -

Short, but very difficult at times

-===-

Overall fantastic game! 9/10

review:

Jogo visualmente bonito, onde vocÃª Ã© uma gotinha de Ã¡gua e tem que concluir objetivos que seriam bÃ¡sicos se nÃ£o fosse por um porÃ©m... Conforme vocÃª avanÃ§a a gotinha diminui de tamanho atÃ©... Morrer. Sem contar que basta relar em algum obstÃ¡culo como fogo ou eletricidade e tchau! Volta para o comeÃ§o da fase e todas as insÃ­gnias sÃ£o perdidas. Tudo isso citado faz um jogo de aparÃªncia fofa se tornar um belo desafio, inclusive por causa de uma conquista que requer que vocÃª pegue todas as "gotinhas douradas" das fases, pois vocÃª pode concluir um nÃ­vel sem pegar uma se quer, mas se quiser platinar vai ter que ralar um pouco. author: {'steamid': '76561198025320454', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1485110658}
review:
Cute platform with very nice "hand-drawn" style.
It's short but enough to fully enjoy it. Also, it's not as easy as you might think since like old style platformers, you have only 1 life so when you die, you have to restart the level again. Rinse and repeat until you learn the level by heart.

And the game is amazingly for free! :-D

PS: kuudos also from some anime references (like Dr.Slump and Saint Seiya!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985668557', 'num_games_owned': 1514, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1485106954}
review:
Pro:[list]
[*]Cute art style.
[*]Relatively relaxing.
[*]Pretty fun.
[*]Neat mechanic in that your character needs to refill constantly.
[/list]

Cons:[list]
[*]The hitbox on your character is constantly changing. This means that some jumps might not work how you remember them due to your hitbox being bigger, or smaller, than it was when last you did something.
[*]Going for all the tokens is annoying. Most tokens revolve around insta-death traps and failing to grab them means you need to play the whole level again, but the levels are really easy, so this makes the game a lot less fun.
[*]The art style, while really nice to look at, leaves a pretty big issue with most objects have weird angles and slopes on them. There are some areas that look like you should be able to just roll onto them, but you need to jump up and sometimes these are in very inopportune spots.
[/list]

If you're looking for a relaxing hour, or so, of platforming this is a good game to play. I highly recommend that you don't bother with going for all the tokens though as that might end up ruining the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066623237', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1485042729}
review:
This is probably the cutest game I've ever played. Amazing level design, great backgrounds, and an adorable character. 10/10 would recommend.

Update: The devs broke my heart. They said forever ago (around a month after release I believe) that they would look into a bug preventing people from collecting the final achievement in the game. They have made no progress, and left us without a way to get the achievement. To top that off, I haven't checked my facts, but I swear they said they were adding more content or something along those lines a while ago, and there has been nothing since.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120366192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1484703725}
review: I spent 51 minutes in this game. More than I should have. Physics aren't that great, especially as an ice cube. I couldn't even bring myself to finish the game. After too many bogus deaths, it was far to aggravating. Seriously though, have you never heard of a checkpoint?? If you do decide to download this game, don't die, especially on the later levels. No matter how far you go (I got to the end of a level 5 times and died at the end), you have to do the entire level all over again. No matter how  long it is. I dunno... Maybe I'm just salty...

author: {'steamid': '76561198121856929', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1484696370}
review: Very cute game with a lovely artwork. The only thing  I could complain about  is the controls. To me it felt a little bit stiff and it went quite out of control on the "Ice" levels. Also would be great to have a restart button. Otherwise, I recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298521757', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1497574516}
review:
Drop Alive es un juego de Plataformas que trata que eres una Gota de Agua que tiene vida y se despierta en una tarra que tenia agua, se levante y se propone el mismo una misiÃ³n que es salir a la Cocina (o la Casa donde esta)... que digamos que ese es toda su aventura no puedo decir otra cosa (ni el final por que dejo un rico Spoiler), pero bueno aquÃ­ dejare mi anÃ¡lisis del juego ;).

*LO BUENO*

-Sus GrÃ¡ficos: 
 Lo que me agrada que su estilo grÃ¡fico es como un dibujo (y ese estilo me fascinan) que esta bien detallado. (para mi punto de vista)

-Su Dificultad
No digo que el juego no estÃ¡n fÃ¡cil, y no estÃ¡n difÃ­cil el chiste es que eres una Gota de Agua y eso por obvias razones la Gota se hace pequeÃ±o poco a poco hasta el punto que te mueras (y eso pasa en lugares calientes o lugares que te absorben Ej: Esponja) y por eso aveces puede llegar unas etapas que te puede estar un rato en el mismo lugar (es decir te puedes morir mas de 5 veces)

-Su Jugabilidad
Para mi la Jugabilidad es Original (es mi punto de vista, no se si hay otros con ese estilo de juego) y que nos propone el juego que tiene 3 habilidades que es la lÃ³gica del agua (Liquido, Gaseoso y Solido) y esos 3 tiene diferentes formas de jugar, y son:

-La Gota de Agua (Liquido): Que es la tÃ­pica jugabilidad bÃ¡sica de un juego de Plataformas y que te puedes avanzar en la Derecha y la Izquierda y te puedes trepar en la paredes.

-La Nube (Gaseoso): Te da la habilidad de flotar (como el Globo P del Super Mario World) pero tiene una condiciÃ³n que si la gota esta pequeÃ±a y si te moves mucho... te mueres.

-La Bola de Hielo (Solido): Esta habilidad te da mas velocidad pero es algo difÃ­cil saltar.

(La Nube y la Bola de Hielo no tiene salto de pared)

*LO MALO*

Que es corto el juego... y bueno... es lo Ãºnico malo para mi xd

Ese fue mi anÃ¡lisis (y lo se, es muy largo pero me~) espero que lo hayan disfrutado y o la hayan Ãºtil ;)

P.D: Me sorprende que este juego tiene GrÃ¡ficos muy chulo y a la vez es Free To Play... enserio me sorprende.

review:
En este juego tomamos el lugar de una gota de agua rebelde que decide que ya estÃ¡ grande para seguir en la casa de la familia. Decide ir hasta el rio que se encuentra pasando un microondas, heladera, techo, etc. Es un juego con cierta dificultad tirando a fÃ¡cil lo mÃ¡s "difÃ­cil" es que al morir empezaremos los niveles desde cero con lo que perderemos todo el avance que habÃ­amos conseguido en el nivel.
 
[b]NO TOMAR ENCERIO[/b]

[spoiler]Este juego tiene un gran entusiasmo al mostrarnos que si se quiere se puede, empezamos siendo una gota de agua viviente la cual tiene sobrepeso. Esta decide que no puede seguir asÃ­, es tiempo de hacer ejercicio, por el medio de caminar y dar saltos. Pero no solo trata este tema, tambiÃ©n entra la mala alimentacion al no ingerir los alimentos necesarios mostrÃ¡ndonos que si no nos alimentamos bien (ingiriendo agua en el caso de ella) terminaremos muriendo.[/spoiler]

Surtout tÃ¨s bien imaginÃ©, avec cette petite goutelette qui affronte les lois de la physique, pour se transformer en vapeur ou encore en glaÃ§on, et affronter ses ennemis naturels comme le pain et l'electricitÃ©. Vraiment sympa pour une petite heure d'amusement !

author: {'steamid': '76561198353816972', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1489328269}
review: I die repeatedly, but I don't seem to get frustrated. I think it's because it's so dang cute. The music is very cheerful too. It gets a bit repetitious after a while, but it's something that I may just decide to play one day months down the line, and it will be very easy to just pick up and play without much thought. It's a great "mindless" game to pass the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198337265219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1491611031}
review:
I lost count of how many times I died in level four alone, but something kept me from really getting frustrated even at the worst of times. Whether it's the wonderful aesthetic, the cute concept, or just the simple fact that the game is really fun and I don't need a reason, I don't know. Whatever it is, this game is a fun challenge, a great way to spend a couple hours, and honestly I would've been willing to pay money for more of it. 

To the devs: thank you so much for sharing this, and if you're planning on any other projects in the future then I wish you the best of luck.

review: Drop alive is a platformer where you play as a drop of water and throughout your journey you can change into the various states of water: liquid, solid and gas. Beyound it is cute aesthetic the game is harder than it looks and most casual platform players like myself will be faced with levels where you die a good amount of times and the levels dont have checkpoints so you are put back right at the begining in the early levels into doesnt matter much since the levels are shorter but at the later levels it is a little annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274857590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1484428817}
review: Cute platform game, a bit short, but very good for a free game. I like the simple but effective graphics and the overall athmosphere of the game. It is original in many ways. Its a little bit hard at some places, but not too hard. Its a game you will probably complete in a couple of hours. If that is what you are looking for a late saturday night or that monday when you are in bed with a cold, then just click download and have a good run!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049176997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1484231425}
review:
If you like being in an abusive relationship, this game is for you. Let me explain. The artwork is beautiful and well made, they anthropomorphised a water droplet (really ingenious game design there, very original - you can see in the other comments how far cute anthropomorphic things can get you) and made the levels look good. So on the surface you look like your getting a good deal.
Then you get to know this game and you realise its just another trial and error re-hash of every indie trial and error before it.
Now dont get me wrong, if you enjoy getting kicked in the balls repeatedly, while coughing up blood, then yes, this game is for you. If not stay away, or just pop in for the artwork because that definitely makes it worthwhile.

All in all i would recommend it for the art but thats it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164382571', 'num_games_owned': 1104, 'num_reviews': 422, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1483982872}
review:
[i][b]Drop Alive[/b][/i] est un jeu de plate-forme d'une qualitÃ© certaine, relativement Ã  son prix tout Ã  fait exorbitant. Nous y incarnons une goutte d'eau qui aspire Ã  la libertÃ©. Pour cela, elle devra traverser la cuisine, avec entre autres le congÃ©lateur, le micro-onde et le four (oui, elle s'Ã©gare des fois), puis les Ã©gouts. La nature de cet environnement modifiera donc son Ã©tat : liquide, solide ou bien gazeux, chacun d'eux ayant son lot d'avantages et d'inconvÃ©nients.

A l'Ã©tat liquide, elle sera capable de grimper aux murs, mais perdra peu Ã  peu consistance. Aussi mourra-t-elle Ã  petit feu, Ã  moins de trouver une source Ã  laquelle s'alimenter. A l'Ã©tat gazeux, elle s'Ã©tiole selon le mÃªme principe. En contrepartie, elle pourra voler. Enfin, Ã  l'Ã©tat solide, elle devient insensible aux dangers qui l'entourent, elle peut dÃ©truire certains obstacles et ne subira aucune perte au fil du temps, mais ne pourra que rouler, avec une maniabilitÃ© rÃ©duite. Le moindre contact avec l'eau lui fera par ailleurs reprendre forme liquide.

Sans Ãªtre inoubliables, les musiques sont trÃ¨s entraÃ®nantes. Le jeu se boucle assez vite, car il ne comporte qu'une douzaine de niveaux : comptez entre une heure et une heure et demie - pour un prix, rappelons-le, des plus indÃ©cents ! Chacun d'eux "recÃ¨le" trois tokens, qui permettent de dÃ©bloquer des skins pour les diffÃ©rents Ã©tats de notre protagoniste. Vous trouverez par exemple un masque du chevalier du cygne pour l'Ã©tat gazeux.

Si [i][b]Drop Alive[/b][/i] ne casse pas trois pattes Ã  un canard, il propose nÃ©anmoins un gameplay sympathique, basÃ© sur des idÃ©es intÃ©ressantes, le tout pour pas un rond.

[h1]Verdict : 3,5/5 - Ce qui est bien, mais pas top.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198019457603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1527189831}
review:
[b]Review brought to you by[/b]:
[h1][url=store.steampowered.com/curator/34470115/]TentacleBunny's Cozy Cottage[/url][/h1]

Drop Alive is a very cute and fluffy platformer that will challenge you to have fun and have good time through all the game levels.

Drop Alive was developed by Invi Games and published by Ipsilon Developments and is accessible to everyone since it is a free to play game on Steam. 

In Drop Alive, you play as a small drop of water lost inside a big house and you have to help her get out of there through several challenging levels. It also plays away with the climate conditions and the multiple water states to help you traverse and reach the final stage of each level. You also have to collect 3 special coins on every single level to have a perfect score and sometimes those are not easy to accomplish. Especially tricky because if you die, you will have to restart the level from the very start.

Level design is simply gorgeous, the background splash art and drawings are so well made it screams cute and fun all the way. The drop itself is so likeable and makes you feel anxious every single time something bad happens to her. But the levels have satisfactory difficulty levels, from easy to actually hard ones to go through. And that variety is a strong point in the whole game.

The sounds in this game are what makes you go on cuteness overload, the drop sounds are extra cute and the environment sounds are very well made, according to each part of the levels you are in to help the immersion.

Overall, this game had me hooked from the very first level. It also has steam achievements so it is a plus. But the game itself, even tho it is a free to play game, it is totally worth your time. If you are looking for a fun yet challenging game to play for a while, try it out and you will love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121992725', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1495808023}
review:
Drop Alive, what about it?

I liked this game, it was cute, it was was fun, it was challenging and in my opinion I think you should give it a try. When I played this game, I only played it for achievements, but now I am actually playing this game for both achievements and fun. Now I do have to say, that this game can be rage inducing at times but if you like a good challenge and a nice platformer, why not play Drop Alive? Now I really like this game and I think you would enjoy this game as well. 

Now I should have mentioned that this game has a lot of cheap deaths and a lot of areas you will cringe in pain. Anyways, I think this game deserves an 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198014926595', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 967, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1572113208}
review:
Okay... credit where credit is due.  For a hand-made work, [i]Drop Alive[/i] is well done.  But the main reason I don't recommend it is simply because of its difficulty.

Imagine standing on surfaces too long and dying.  Imagine staying as a water drop or cloud for too long and (even when idling) shrinking until you die.  Imagine acid pools, acid fountains, and flame spouts instantly murdering you.  Of course, let's also imagine electricity and spikes that kill you instantly (sparks quickly shrinking you).  Now imagine doing all this...without checkpoints.

I get that this game is hard and I respect their decision to keep it hard...but at the same time, it harms its enjoyability.  The 100% token achievement makes it even harder.  If challenge is what you wish, good luck.  If you want an easy (or casual) 100%, you might want to look elsewhere.

4/10  A difficult experience that caused more anxiety than fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162357120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1483725095}
review:
I shall call him squishy and he shall be mine. He shall be my squishy.

Drop Alive is a bit of a mixed bag, but woth checking out for free.

Pros:
*Hand-drawn artwork and animation lend the game a plesant storybook feel. The squishy water droplet is adorable.
*The  concept and mechanics of the water shrinking, as well as changing form to steam and ice are imaginative and fantastic (when they work).
*Soundtrack is nice and unobtrusive-- I'd actually like an option to download the soundtrack and listen to it by itself.

Cons:
*Several reviewers have compared Drop Alive to Super Meat Boy, and although I understand the comparison (because of the frequent deaths), it doesn't hold up as well.
*It's a bit slow paced for the type of platformer it is; it's not puzzly enough (for my tastes) to be as slow as it is.
*Its controls are nowhere near as tight as those in SMB, and a lot of the collisions seem off. Sometimes, for example, spikes will kill you, but sometimes you can stand on them like a platform. Sometimes the drop jumps right when you want him to, but sometimes he just sort of schluffs along, to his doom. In a platformer-- especially one with so much death-- precision is key, and Drop Alive just isn't there.
*Which leads me to my final criticism-- the rage factor. Unfair feeling deaths made this game more frustrating than fun, which is at direct odds with the game's cute/relaxing aesthetic.

So come for the artwork and the concept, not for the gameplay. If that sounds like something you'd like (and I can think of worse ways to spend 45 minutes or so), give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095917598', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 1815, 'playtime_forever': 3458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1666498574}
review:
Bom vamos lÃ¡ pessoal, oque dizer sobre o Drop Alive:

Breve DescriÃ§Ã£o :

Drop Alive Ã© um jogo no estilo Plataforma/Aventura, aonde vocÃª assume o papel de um pequena gota d'Ã¡gua!

O jogo Ã© se passado por fases, aonde vocÃª deve entender as mecÃ¢nicas do mapa pra conseguir passar pelos desafios!

No geral, o gameplay Ã© bem interessante, e Ã© daqueles que vocÃª passa horas jogando sem perceber!

Pra finalizar, Ã© Free2Play! Se vocÃª gosta de jogos de plataforma, nÃ£o pense duas vezes pra baixar!

AnÃ¡lise:

Pontos Positivos:

* GrÃ¡ficos agradaveis para o estilo do jogo.
* MecÃ¢nicas interessantes que combinam com a temÃ¡tica do jogo.
* Jogabilidade extremamente simples e facil de aprender.

Pontos Negativos:

* O Ãºnico ponto negativo na minha opiniÃ£o, Ã© a falta de "Checkpoints" dentro das fases, para salvar o progresso. Entretando isso Ã© bem relativo devido ao estilo de jogo.

Caso queiram dar uma olhada no jogo, segue a anÃ¡lise comentada !

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bEAd3M_PW3Q An amazingly novel game, where you are a water droplet and have to jump your way through a series of obstacles - essentially a level game. You take various forms, including steam. Graphically cartoony but very impressive. Humorous sounds as the water droplet gets excited or upset, depending on your gameplay. And all round fun game.

Make up your own mind with this gameplay: https://youtu.be/Kq0Wejwvmd0 A fun and frustrating experience (similar to Super Meat Boy).
It starts off smooth sailing but then things take a turn, and many many many many many deaths occur.
Risk and repeat is the formula.
Took me 1 hour to beat but there is a Time Trial Mode to play too.
If you like the sound of all this then Drop Alive is perfect for you.

The soundtrack is also fantastic.
If you happen to not know what the tokens do - they allow you to unlock different forms of the droplet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052412158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1480994542}
review:
Me encantÃ³ jugar este juego, es de los mÃ¡s tiernos que tuve la chance de jugar en Steam con el plus que no es fÃ¡cil encontrar juegos gratuitos tan lindos y de calidad.

La idea es jugar una gotita de agua sÃºper cute que debe moverse por diversos lugares muy peligrosos, no solo para ella sino para nosotros ya que es bastante complejo ya a partir del tercer nivel. 

La grÃ¡fica es sencilla y hermosa a la vez, con unos fondos muy clÃ¡sicos y la gotita moviÃ©ndose a lo largo de la cocina y otros sitios. Es muy buena la chance de conseguir skins y vamos a poder ver a la gotita transformarse en vapor o volver a ser agua. Hay que tener cuidado de no intentar algo muchas veces ya que la gota de agua va a perder densidad y ahÃ­ perderemos el juego. Lo bueno es que siempre se puede retomar el nivel y seguir.

Agradezco a los desarrolladores por darnos esta propuesta tan bonita en todo sentido.

review:
Drop Alive maneja el mismo concepto del mÃ­tico (e ignorado) Dewy's Adventure para WII, una tierna gotita de agua cuyo objetivo es sobrevivir y cuidarse de los objetos que podrÃ­an secarla o romperla. La gotita no sÃ³lo aparece en su estado lÃ­quido, si no tambiÃ©n en sÃ³lido y gaseoso, lo cuÃ¡l hace que este juego tenga dinÃ¡micas muy interesantes. Es muy corto pero bastante entretenido, una joya free-to-play que muchos deberÃ­an atreverse a probar.

review:
Bom vamos lÃ¡ pessoal, oque dizer sobre o Drop Alive:

Breve DescriÃ§Ã£o :

Drop Alive Ã© um jogo no estilo Plataforma/Aventura, aonde vocÃª assume o papel de um pequena gota d'Ã¡gua!

O jogo Ã© se passado por fases, aonde vocÃª deve entender as mecÃ¢nicas do mapa pra conseguir passar pelos desafios!

No geral, o gameplay Ã© bem interessante, e Ã© daqueles que vocÃª passa horas jogando sem perceber!

Pra finalizar, Ã© Free2Play! Se vocÃª gosta de jogos de plataforma, nÃ£o pense duas vezes pra baixar!

* Jogabilidade extremamente simples e facil de aprender.

Pontos Negativos:

author: {'steamid': '76561198154851564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1481369896}
review:
Drop Alive is an amazing game. I discovered this game this morning and had so much fun playing it. If you're considering getting this game I'd appreciate if you checked out my fan-made trailer for it because I'm sure it would give you a taste of what this game has to offer. Thanks and great job to the developers - feel free to use my trailer on Steam (with due credit).

My  fan-made trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HF2-eK6I0ss&lc=z125i5qgqnuezzot4231ifrbizmrsplyd04

author: {'steamid': '76561198071638258', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1481735269}
review:
At no poin while playing this game  I felt that I lost because of bad controls. They are quite responsive, It feels hard but fair. I'm not a plataform game kind of guy, But I can see that this was made with Greeat care for detail. It left me wanting more, wich is a really good sign.

There's no reason NOT to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2587, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1481278121}
review: Drop Alive is a pretty fun platformer/ adventure game. You play as a drop of water on a journey, using its different states (solid, liquid, gas) to complete puzzles and get around obstacles. Simple idea but pulled of well in my opinion. I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062921196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1481169848}
review:
Lo recomiendo! Drop Alive es un muy buen juego de plataformas con lindo arte y musica.
Lo "malo" es que es un poco corto, esperemos que agreguen mÃ¡s niveles, asÃ­ se pueden aprovechar mejor todas las mecÃ¡nicas que son muy interesantes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067031560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1481145185}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080781652', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2, 'last_played': 1503636902}
review:
As i said in my Deluxe Edition review, I played Drop Alive because it was free and seemed cute. It turned out to be great game, so i think the devs deserve a little collaboration. Buying the Deluxe Edition was the least i could do, and Iâ€™m glad I did, the artbook has a lot of awesome and adorable content.


The game is surprisingly difficult, something I didnâ€™t expect, and it was a lot of fun but kinda short. Overall it took me about an hour and a half to finish it. I totally recommend that you give ir a try :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972465344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1481141681}
review: Cute little game. Too bad it doesn't have checkpoints or other saving system. I hate nerve cracking games where you need to be able to do a perfect run on a level; one mistake and it's all over again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084151301', 'num_games_owned': 628, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1489602676}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003048244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1481121071}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198015468267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1481116429}
review:
A fun and frustrating experience (similar to Super Meat Boy).
It starts off smooth sailing but then things take a turn, and many many many many many deaths occur.
Risk and repeat is the formula.
Took me 1 hour to beat but there is a Time Trial Mode to play too.
If you like the sound of all this then Drop Alive is perfect for you.

The soundtrack is also fantastic.
If you happen to not know what the tokens do - they allow you to unlock different forms of the droplet.
